Title: Data Analyst (w/m/d)
Description:
We are Billie, the leading provider of Buy Now, Pay Later (BNPL) payment methods for businesses, offering B2B companies innovative digital payment services and modern checkout solutions. We are to create a new standard for business payments and have made it our mission to simplify the purchasing experience for all businesses making it a tool for growth. Our solutions are based on proprietary, machine-learning-supported risk models, fully digitized processes and a highly scalable tech platform. This makes us a deep-tech company building financial products, not the other way around. We love building simple and elegant solutions and we strive for automation and scalability.

About The Role

Billie’s Analytics team is at the heart of the company supporting multiple functions to make data-driven decisions. Analytics team works closely with all Product segments, and other departments by innovating, hypothesizing, strategizing and providing recommended actions to relevant stakeholders (Decision science, Business Development and Account Management, Collection and Underwriting teams, Customer support and Marketing) in an integrated, scalable, secure and compliant way to enable the company's sustainable growth.

In this role, you will have the chance to make a significant impact by leveraging data and analytics tools, will look for solutions, establish relationships to be able to guide business decisions within the company values and expectations, and contribute to the ongoing growth of our portfolio.

The role is for someone who is a self-starter, enjoys exploring data for insights to support strategic decision making, is passionate about building data structures, analyzing and reporting on key performance indicators, comfortable to work on operational matters, willing to develop expertise in fraud and credit risk prevention, has excellent communication and strong interpersonal skills, is able to document effectively.

This is a unique opportunity for analysts who are eager to immerse themselves in the heart of fintech business, develop additional muscles, and grow within a fast-paced and dynamic environment. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, apply creative problem-solving skills, and drive business growth through data-driven strategies.

Responsibilities


Perform analysis to develop a deep understanding of the product, and its usage, business processes, and to support business and research hypotheses, including A/B testing of product ideas, identifying new product and business opportunities
Support product segments in creating effective tracking and measurement plans to ensure the impact of new features align with our product strategy
Design data models as part of data solution to support reporting and analysis needs
Create, maintain and update dashboards and reports using BI tools to communicate insights effectively
Enhance data processes, identify gaps, and streamline data collection
Collect, consolidate, and closely track KPI metrics regarding Billie’s portfolio
Perform comprehensive data analysis and EDA to support Risk and Fraud systems optimization
Communicate and present recommendations and key insights to stakeholders and executives to drive business decisions and create an impact
Communicate issues in an independent and timely manner with appropriate internal and external partners


Who We Are Looking For


You have 5+ years of proven experience in data analytics, data engineering or quantitative analytics
Proficiency in writing structured and efficient SQL queries for large data sets
Proficiency in data and analytics concepts, tools, and methodologies
Have prior experience building intuitive data visualizations and dashboards that influence business decisions, utilizing tools like Looker, Tableau, Mixpanel, or similar
Proven track record of managing complex initiatives with strong emphasis on data, providing actionable insights and tracking success of those initiatives
Able to communicate complex problems in a simple and relevant manner at all levels
Experience with translating analytical insights into data driven business prioritization
You have strong business acumen coupled with highly analytical mindset
You had the chance to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
Strong sense of responsibility, self-starter, well organized, good planner, able to work independently and meet deadlines
Previously experience in a fraud, risk & payment management environment is an advantage


What We Offer


Challenging and impactful work that drives personal and professional growth
One of the best Virtual Shares Incentive Programs in the market, so that everyone at Billie is invested in our success
Flexible work hours and trust in your ability to deliver, empowering you to take control of your work-life balance
A hybrid working approach that allows you to work from home for up to 3 days per week
Enjoy 30 days vacation per year on top of paid public holidays, sabbatical opportunities, and extra child sickness leave for parents
Our “Catch a Ride with Billie” program that enables discounted access to Berlin Public Transport (BVG), Deutschland-Ticket, OR JobRad
A yearly development budget to broaden your skill set and horizons
Free German group classes
An English-speaking, multicultural team with more than 40 nationalities represented
Building meaningful connections with your colleagues through company and team events, interest groups, the Billie run club, game nights, and more, powered by our Formula Fun Team!
Great office space at Checkpoint Charlie with free gym access, barista coffee, drinks and more


Billie offers you the opportunity to be a part of one of the fastest-growing Fintech startups in Europe following the mission to innovate to create new freedom for businesses of all sizes. Our combined decades of experience in B2B Financing and Payments in a market thirsty for innovation and change make this a fantastic possibility to get into the most dynamic space in tech.

Join an international team of talented, passionate people where drive and merit matter. We work in nimble, cross-functional teams with open communication lines across the company. You’ll be surrounded by smart people from a wide variety of backgrounds from which you can learn and that want to learn from you.

Are you ready to join Billie?

Billie is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment in our workplace. By embracing talents and abilities of all kinds, we aim to boost motivation and team creativity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, age, marital status, gender, political views, beliefs, sexual orientation, color, disability status, or any other demographic factors.

Please Note

Our policy includes a 180-day waiting period before reconsidering candidates for the same role. This ensures a fair and thorough evaluation of all applicants. If you apply within this cool-off period, your application will be automatically rejected.

Thank you for your understanding.
Show more

  • Collect, consolidate, and closely track KPI metrics regarding Billie’s portfolio
  • Perform comprehensive data analysis and EDA to support Risk and Fraud systems optimization
  • Communicate and present recommendations and key insights to stakeholders and executives to drive business decisions and create an impact
  • Communicate issues in an independent and timely manner with appropriate internal and external partners

Who We Are Looking For

  • You have 5+ years of proven experience in data analytics, data engineering or quantitative analytics
  • Proficiency in writing structured and efficient SQL queries for large data sets
  • Proficiency in data and analytics concepts, tools, and methodologies
  • Have prior experience building intuitive data visualizations and dashboards that influence business decisions, utilizing tools like Looker, Tableau, Mixpanel, or similar
  • Proven track record of managing complex initiatives with strong emphasis on data, providing actionable insights and tracking success of those initiatives
  • Able to communicate complex problems in a simple and relevant manner at all levels
  • Experience with translating analytical insights into data driven business prioritization
  • You have strong business acumen coupled with highly analytical mindset
  • You had the chance to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
  • Strong sense of responsibility, self-starter, well organized, good planner, able to work independently and meet deadlines
  • Previously experience in a fraud, risk & payment management environment is an advantage

What We Offer

  • Challenging and impactful work that drives personal and professional growth
  • One of the best Virtual Shares Incentive Programs in the market, so that everyone at Billie is invested in our success
  • Flexible work hours and trust in your ability to deliver, empowering you to take control of your work-life balance
  • A hybrid working approach that allows you to work from home for up to 3 days per week
  • Enjoy 30 days vacation per year on top of paid public holidays, sabbatical opportunities, and extra child sickness leave for parents
  • Our “Catch a Ride with Billie” program that enables discounted access to Berlin Public Transport (BVG), Deutschland-Ticket, OR JobRad
  • A yearly development budget to broaden your skill set and horizons
  • Free German group classes
  • An English-speaking, multicultural team with more than 40 nationalities represented
  • Building meaningful connections with your colleagues through company and team events, interest groups, the Billie run club, game nights, and more, powered by our Formula Fun Team!
  • Great office space at Checkpoint Charlie with free gym access, barista coffee, drinks and more

Billie offers you the opportunity to be a part of one of the fastest-growing Fintech startups in Europe following the mission to innovate to create new freedom for businesses of all sizes. Our combined decades of experience in B2B Financing and Payments in a market thirsty for innovation and change make this a fantastic possibility to get into the most dynamic space in tech.

Join an international team of talented, passionate people where drive and merit matter. We work in nimble, cross-functional teams with open communication lines across the company. You’ll be surrounded by smart people from a wide variety of backgrounds from which you can learn and that want to learn from you.

Are you ready to join Billie?

Billie is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment in our workplace. By embracing talents and abilities of all kinds, we aim to boost motivation and team creativity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, age, marital status, gender, political views, beliefs, sexual orientation, color, disability status, or any other demographic factors.

Please Note

Our policy includes a 180-day waiting period before reconsidering candidates for the same role. This ensures a fair and thorough evaluation of all applicants. If you apply within this cool-off period, your application will be automatically rejected.

Thank you for your understanding.

Title: Senior Data Analyst (f/m/x)
Description:
EMBRACE THE WORLD: HOP ON YOUR NEXT ADVENTURE WITH US!

We are a lively and diverse team, founded by our CEO Julian Weselek in 2016, currently active in the DACH region and France. Our ambition is to become the leading travel company for authentic, customized, multi-day trips while being mindful of our planet: we are the first travel company in the EU to set near-term carbon reduction targets approved by the Science Based Targets initiative (SBTi): this is an imperative step toward decarbonization. We are and always will be driving the change in the travel industry for a better tomorrow.

DESTINATION? THE WORLD!

We are discoverers. We are believers in the life-changing power of travel. On our journey we've built the amazing team that we have today - a team that sets the ambition to be remembered for building the future of travel, for consistently changing the norms of the industry and, simply, for staying true to our passion for bringing together the cultures of the world.

What is the role about?


Ultimately, we work to create the best experience in travel, using data to improve our customer experience and our product, increase our marketing reach, and optimize our costs
Own data projects fully end to end. You will manage data pipelines, ensure data quality, model data in dbt, and put them into reports or visualizations in Looker
Bring ideas to life. We welcome prototyping solutions that generate impact right away
Work as one team with Data Engineers, Data Scientists, Data Analysts, and business users to maintain and improve our data infrastructure
The Tools We Use:
Warehousing and ELT: Snowflake, dbt, SQL
Visualisation: Looker (LookML)
Data Sources and Importing Tools: Salesforce, Internal Applications, Event Data, Fivetran and Airbyte
Ad-Hoc Analysis: SQL, R, Python



What will you need to be successful?


You are proficient in SQL and bring previous experience in data analytics, data science, business intelligence, or a related field. We welcome applicants with an academic background
You have knowledge of statistics - using statistical concepts in testing, modeling, and forecasting
You have a strong business mindset and you are able to communicate data topics to non-technical stakeholders
You are able to work independently and have a problem-solving mindset
You like to collaborate with your colleagues. You ask colleagues when you’re stuck and help them out when they are. You discuss ideas and challenges



YOU ARE THE WORLD


We value your participation in Tourlane's success and complement your cash compensation with a package of employee stock options (ESOP)
Flexible working setup to get the most of your working hours: we offer full flexibility in our Hybrid/Remote model, however we do expect that you take advantage of our lively Berlin office 2-3 days per week
We share your passion for traveling: enjoy working abroad through our new program
Your wellbeing matters to us: we offer mindfulness classes to take care of your mental health, sessions with Nilo.health
We support all the diverse communities that make us Tourlane: join or create your own Employee Resource Group (ERG) and connect with Tourlaneans
Dog-friendly office: we can’t wait to meet your furry friend!



Sounds interesting? We are excited to get to know you!

Data privacy policy.

Title: Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Werde Teil eines innovativen Teams bei Education Partners als “Data Analyst” (m/w/d)




Bist du begeistert von der Macht der Daten und möchtest entscheidende Einblicke liefern, die den Unternehmenserfolg vorantreiben? Education Partners, ein führendes Unternehmen im Bereich der transformativen Bildung, gestaltet das Lernen und Wachsen neu. Mit aktuell 12 hochmodernen Akademien in ganz Europa treiben wir Innovationen in der digitalen Bildung voran.




Was wir bieten:

Hybrides Arbeitsmodell: Genieße die Flexibilität, sowohl von zu Hause als auch in unserem modernen Büro im Herzen Berlins zu arbeiten.
Modernste Technologie-Umgebung: Nutze die neuesten Datenanalyse-Tools und Business Intelligence-Lösungen in einem dynamischen Umfeld.
Wirkungsvolle Arbeit: Deine Analysen und Insights beeinflussen direkt die strategischen Entscheidungen.
Berufliche Weiterentwicklung: Wir fördern kontinuierliches Lernen durch Zugang zu Workshops, Konferenzen und erstklassigen Weiterbildungsangeboten.
Attraktives Gesamtpaket: Profitiere von 30 Tagen Urlaub, einem Remote-First-Ansatz, modernster Hardware und einem wettbewerbsfähigen Gehalt.




Dein Impact:

Datenanalyse & Insights: Du analysierst große und komplexe Datensätze, um wertvolle Insights zu gewinnen, die unser Verständnis von Kundenverhalten, Markttrends und Geschäftsentwicklungen vertiefen.
Dashboard- & Reporting-Erstellung: Du entwickelst aussagekräftige Dashboards und Berichte, um datenbasierte Entscheidungen zu erleichtern – idealerweise mit Power BI oder vergleichbaren Tools.
Datengetriebene Prozessoptimierung: Du identifizierst Potenziale zur Verbesserung interner Prozesse und unterstützt die Fachbereiche dabei, datenbasierte Strategien umzusetzen.
Zusammenarbeit mit Fachabteilungen: Du arbeitest eng mit Teams aus Marketing, Produkt und Business Development zusammen, um operative sowie strategische Maßnahmen zu steuern.
Tracking & Datenqualität: Du stellst sicher, dass relevante Daten zuverlässig erfasst werden. Dafür unterstützt du bei der Implementierung von Tracking- und Analyse-Tools wie Google Analytics und Google Tag Manager.
Automatisierung & Skalierung: Du optimierst Datenprozesse, entwickelst Automatisierungen und sorgst für eine effiziente Nutzung der verfügbaren Datenquellen.




Was wir suchen:

Analytische Denkweise & datengetriebenes Mindset: Du hast ein ausgeprägtes Gespür für Daten, erfasst komplexe Zusammenhänge schnell und übersetzt diese in präzise Handlungsempfehlungen.
Tools: Du bist sicher im Umgang mit SQL und Excel/Google Sheets und kannst große Datensätze effizient analysieren und verarbeiten.
Erfahrung mit Datenvisualisierung: Du kennst Dich mit Tools wie Power BI, Tableau oder Looker aus und erstellst Dashboards und Berichte, die wichtige KPIs verständlich darstellen (Power BI bevorzugt).
Kenntnisse in Tracking & Web Analytics: Idealerweise hast Du Erfahrung mit Google Analytics und Google Tag Manager (GTM) und weißt, wie man Nutzerverhalten richtig auswertet.
Teamplayer & Kommunikationsstärke: Du arbeitest gerne mit verschiedenen Fachabteilungen zusammen und kannst komplexe Daten verständlich präsentieren – auch für Nicht-Analysten.
Startup-Mentalität & Eigeninitiative: Du fühlst dich in dynamischen Umfeldern wohl, übernimmst Verantwortung und treibst datengetriebene Projekte eigenständig voran.
Sprachkenntnisse: Fließende Deutschkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift sind für diese Rolle erforderlich.

Nice-to-Have:

Erfahrung im Marketing oder Performance Marketing und ein Verständnis für datengetriebene Marketingstrategien.
Erfahrung mit Automatisierung und Skalierung von Datenprozessen.
Kenntnisse in der Anwendung von Machine Learning oder Predictive Analytics sind ein Plus.




Werde Teil unseres Teams und hilf dabei, die Zukunft des Lernens zu gestalten, indem du fundierte datengetriebene Entscheidungen ermöglicht, die unsere Geschäftsstrategie maßgeblich beeinflussen.

Title: Senior Data Analyst (f/m/x)
Description:
CarOnSale is a start-up in the heart of Berlin. As a tech company, we have made it our mission to enable smooth digital processes in the automotive trade across Europe. Join us and develop new, innovative solutions for the B2B sector.

For our Data based at our HQ in Berlin - Schöneberg, we are looking for a Senior Data Analyst (f/m/x)

Your tasks:

Data Analysis:


Analyse and interpret data from various sources to extract meaningful insights.
Identify opportunities for data-driven decision-making within the organisation.
Define and maintain key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure success.



Project Leadership:


Lead data exploration projects to uncover actionable insights.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and define data needs for various business initiatives.



Dashboard Creation:


Develop and maintain dashboards that enable stakeholders to monitor and analyse critical business metrics.



Report Generation:


Generate reports that provide valuable insights to support decision-making across multiple teams.



Stakeholder Management:


Engage with internal stakeholders to ensure their expectations align with our deliverables.
Manage multiple projects simultaneously, setting clear expectations for scope and timeline.
Cultivate and maintain strong relationships with stakeholders and product managers.



Enablement:


Provide support to enhance daily reporting and analytics tasks within the company.
Offer training and education to team members on data analysis tools and techniques for better decision-making



Your profile


4+ years’ experience as a data analyst
Proven experience in data analysis, interpretation, and visualisation.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and languages (e.g., SQL, Tableau).
Experience working with Python.
Strong communication and presentation skills.
Ability to manage multiple projects with attention to detail.
Strong problem-solving and critical-thinking skills.
Familiarity with Google Analytics & tracking data
Fluency in English (C1)



Nice to have:


Being able to communicate in German



Why COS?


First things first: You’ll be taken seriously from day one and will play an important role in our mission, because we want to disrupt Europe’s automotive market together with you
Growth and development: benefit from a detailed on-boarding program, systematic feedback cycles and individual coaching
Your gear, your choice: you will be provided with a MacBook or Windows laptop and all the hardware and software you need to work
Become a COSie: be part of a motivated team with ambitious goals and enjoy lots of fun, lots of awesome team events and a unique COS team spirit
Truly diverse and inclusive: Diversity is important to you? It is important to us too! Diversity in which everyone feels comfortable, is absolutely central to us



Show more
HTML:
CarOnSale is a start-up in the heart of Berlin. As a tech company, we have made it our mission to enable smooth digital processes in the automotive trade across Europe. Join us and develop new, innovative solutions for the B2B sector.

For our Data based at our HQ in Berlin - Schöneberg, we are looking for a Senior Data Analyst (f/m/x)

Your tasks:

Data Analysis:

  • Analyse and interpret data from various sources to extract meaningful insights.
  • Identify opportunities for data-driven decision-making within the organisation.
  • Define and maintain key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure success.


Project Leadership:

  • Lead data exploration projects to uncover actionable insights.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and define data needs for various business initiatives.


Dashboard Creation:

  • Develop and maintain dashboards that enable stakeholders to monitor and analyse critical business metrics.


Report Generation:

  • Generate reports that provide valuable insights to support decision-making across multiple teams.


Stakeholder Management:

  • Engage with internal stakeholders to ensure their expectations align with our deliverables.
  • Manage multiple projects simultaneously, setting clear expectations for scope and timeline.
  • Cultivate and maintain strong relationships with stakeholders and product managers.


Enablement:

  • Provide support to enhance daily reporting and analytics tasks within the company.
  • Offer training and education to team members on data analysis tools and techniques for better decision-making


Your profile

  • 4+ years’ experience as a data analyst
  • Proven experience in data analysis, interpretation, and visualisation.
  • Proficiency in data analysis tools and languages (e.g., SQL, Tableau).
  • Experience working with Python.
  • Strong communication and presentation skills.
  • Ability to manage multiple projects with attention to detail.
  • Strong problem-solving and critical-thinking skills.
  • Familiarity with Google Analytics & tracking data
  • Fluency in English (C1)


Nice to have:

  • Being able to communicate in German


Why COS?

  • First things first: You’ll be taken seriously from day one and will play an important role in our mission, because we want to disrupt Europe’s automotive market together with you
  • Growth and development: benefit from a detailed on-boarding program, systematic feedback cycles and individual coaching
  • Your gear, your choice: you will be provided with a MacBook or Windows laptop and all the hardware and software you need to work
  • Become a COSie: be part of a motivated team with ambitious goals and enjoy lots of fun, lots of awesome team events and a unique COS team spirit
  • Truly diverse and inclusive: Diversity is important to you? It is important to us too! Diversity in which everyone feels comfortable, is absolutely central to us

Title: BI-Consultant (m/w/d) - Remote oder Berlin
Description:
Business Intelligence, Corporate Performance und Data Management sowie Controlling und Finanzen: Bei diesen sehr daten- und zahlen­getriebenen Herausforderungen unterstützen wir bei der xax mit einem über 70-köpfigen Team an 5 Standorten deutschlandweit Unternehmen mit der Digitalisierung ihrer individuellen Reporting-, Analyse- und Planungs­prozesse. Von der passenden Tool-Auswahl und der Anforderungsaufnahme über die erfolgreiche Implementierung ihrer individuellen Lösung auf Basis professioneller Software-Werkzeuge bis hin zu Schulungen, Coachings und laufendem Projekt-Support erhalten unsere Kunden seit über 20 Jahren bei uns alles aus einer Hand.




Zur Verstärkung unseres Berliner Teams suchen wir zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt einen BI-Consultant - gern auch zu 100% remote, in Voll- oder Teilzeit.




Was wir Dir bieten:




Spannende, anspruchsvolle und abwechslungsreiche Aufgaben mit viel Gestaltungsfreiraum und Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten, wie bspw.:

Eigenständige Gestaltung von kundenspezifischen BI-Lösungen (Reporting, Planung) unter Einsatz unterschiedlicher BI-Software (u.a. Infor, Board, Jedox, MS Power BI).
Erstellung individueller ETL-Prozesse, relationaler Data Warehouse-Architekturen sowie multidimensionaler Datenbanklösungen unter Nutzung leistungsfähiger BI-Werkzeuge (u.a. DataVault Builder, MS SSIS).
Direkte Kundenkommunikation, fachliche und technische Anforderungsaufnahme und Beratung.
Die Möglichkeit, Deine Stärken und Ideen individuell einzubringen und zu verwirklichen, um Dich dadurch weiter zu entwickeln.
Ein Team mit starkem Zusammenhalt, das Dir für Fragen und Unterstützung zur Verfügung steht.
Vom ersten Tag an eine Kommunikation auf Augenhöhe mit jedem Teammitglied.
Schnelle Entscheidungsprozesse mit viel Platz für neue Ideen.
Flexible und angenehme Arbeitsbedingungen, wie z.B. Home-Office / Remote-Möglichkeiten.




Was Du mitbringst:




Ausgeprägte Dienstleistungsorientierung und hohe Zuverlässigkeit.
Du verfügst über eine abgeschlossene IT-nahe Ausbildung (z. B. als Kaufmann/-frau für IT-System-Management) oder ein Studium der (Wirtschafts-)Informatik – alternativ bringst du eine vergleichbare Qualifikation für diese Position mit.
Erste Erfahrung im Customizing gängiger BI-Systeme (wie z.B. MS Power BI, Infor, Qlik, Board, Jedox o.ä.)
Grundlegendes betriebswirtschaftliches Verständnis sowie erste Erfahrungen im Projektmanagement.
Tatendrang, Eigeninitiative sowie Spaß an neuen Herausforderungen.
Die Fähigkeit, im Team als auch Kunden gegenüber offen, zielgerichtet und lösungsorientiert zu kommunizieren.
Den Anspruch, Dein Wissen stets zu erweitern, Neues zu lernen sowie Dich und Deinen Erfolg selbstbestimmt zu organisieren.
Großes Interesse an regelmäßigem Feedback.
Verantwortlicher Umgang mit Vertrauensarbeitszeit.
Authentisches Auftreten sowie viele Ecken und Kanten.
Ein sehr gutes Ausdrucksvermögen in der deutschen Sprache.




Interesse?




Wir freuen uns über Deine Bewerbung (im PDF-Format) unter Angabe Deines frühesten Eintrittstermins.

Show more

Title: (Junior) Insights Analyst (mensch)
Description:
Über uns

Getreu unserem Motto – People is what makes us us – sind uns deine nachhaltige Ausbildung und Weiterentwicklung, deine ausgeglichene Work-Life-Balance und deine Happiness sehr wichtig. Konkret stellen wir mit 32 Urlaubstagen, 60 % mobilem Arbeiten, bis zu 4 Wochen pro Jahr – im europäischen Ausland – der Möglichkeit remote zu arbeiten, Sabbatical und Überstundenausgleich sicher, dass dir im FUSE-Agentur-Leben nichts fehlt.

In unserem derzeit über 60-köpfigen Team sowie unseren Kund*innen haben wir unser perfektes Match bereits gefunden. Wenn du noch auf der Suche bist, bei „popkulturellem Relevanzmarketing“ neugierig wirst und für Social Media, Influencer Marketing oder Gaming & Esports brennst, dann lass uns zusammen loslegen! Denn : Action Creates Impact .

Dein Job

Als (Junior) Insights Analyst (mensch) bearbeitest du als Teil unseres Data und Analytics Teams in erster Linie die Anfragen unserer Kunden nach Social Media Reportings sowie Social Listening Analysen und beherrschst den Spagat zwischen analytischem und kreativem Denken, um die Kolleg:Innen in deinem und anderen Teams mit datenbasierten Insights zu Kundenmeinungen, Märkten, Zielgruppen, Marken und ihren Social Media-Umfeldern zu versorgen.

Dein Aufgabenbereich

Datenbeschaffung / Toolbedienung

Du bist präzise, schnell, zuverlässig und motiviert, wenn es um die manuelle Erfassung großer (Social Media)- Datenmengen geht, aber auch wissbegierig und begeisterungsfähig, dich diesbezüglich kontinuierlich mit Prozessoptimierung zu befassen, sowie dich in Tools und automatisierte Datenerfassungsprozesse und Methoden einzudenken, um immer bessere Lösungen zu finden.

Datenstrukturierung, Effiziente Datensammlung, Query Writing, Kategorisierung und Datendarstellung werden hier deine täglichen Begleiter.

Studiendurchführung

Von der (manchmal noch recht schwammigen) Fragestellung bis zum fertigen Analysebericht mit guten Insights und Handlungsempfehlungen ist es oft ein weiter aber spannender Weg. Der kann bald auch deiner sein, gemeinsam mit uns im Team.

Du hast ein sehr gutes Gespür für Sprache und Kommunikation? Nice, das brauchst du hier in mindestens dreierlei Hinsicht: Erstens, um aus den Aussagen und Briefings unserer Auftraggeber herausfiltern zu können, wie du ihnen am besten weiterhelfen kannst. Zweitens, wenn es darum geht, die Essenz von Konsumenten-Posts und Kommentaren auf Social Media zu verstehen, schließlich ist Inhaltanalyse unser Daily-Business. Und Drittens, um dann Deine Findings Zielgruppengerecht rüberzubringen - in Reports, in Meetings und bei Präsentationen.

Datenanalyse

Auswertungslogiken passend zu den gegebenen Fragestellungen und Erkenntnisinteressen erstellen, Dimensionierungen & Kategorisierungen für Inhaltsanalysen planen und entwickeln, Daten auszählen, filtern, darstellen, vergleichen, interpretieren, daraus kreative Idee und Empfehlungen ableiten. Das ist dein Playground. Deine Affinität zu Zahlen und Daten kannst du hier immer wieder beweisen. Ein stets strukturiertes Vorgehen und ein souveräner Umgang auch mit großen und komplexen Datenmengen, Statistiken und Zahlen sind für dich selbstverständlich.

Spezielle Social Media Analyse-Tools wirst Du ebenso (kennenlernen und) zum Einsatz bringen wie ganz viel Excel und das gute alte Powerpoint.

Das bringst du mit

Du kannst (erste) Erfahrung in der qualitativen und quantitativen Forschungsarbeit, sowie in der marketing- oder kundenorientierten Projektarbeit vorweisen und hast Lust dich im Bereich Social Media Analytics weiter auszutoben. Du hast, dank deines Studiums, einen kommunikations-, sozial- oder medienwissenschaftlichen Background und bringst Kenntnisse der Methoden im Bereich der quantitativen und qualitativen Marktforschung mit. Du hast neben den analytischen Fähigkeiten, auch ein Gespür für gute kreative Kommunikation und Lust, diese mitzuentwickeln. Du bist organisiert und selbständig, willst aber auch noch ständig ganz viel lernen und verstehst dich als Teamplayer, der immer auf Höhe des Zeitgeists ist und daraus neue Impulse für unsere Teams und Kunden ableitet. Außerdem hast Du sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift, sehr gute MS Office Kenntnisse, insbesondere Excel und PowerPoint und bist im besten Fall mit Analytics Tools im Bereich Social Listening & Web Analytics vertraut.

Darum wir

Als Teil der FUSE erfährst du stets Rückenwind von deinem Team, arbeitest für Kunden - die unsere Werte „BOLD. TRUE. EASY. TOGETHER.“ leben und kannst aktiv Prozesse und Strukturen mitentwickeln. Denn ganz getreu unserem Wert TOGETHER setzen wir auf das Potential im Team. Neben unvergesslichen Events bieten wir dir viel Raum für persönliche und berufliche Weiterentwicklung.
Show more

Title: Junior Data Engineer- Berlin - 60k
Description:
Junior Data Engineer- Berlin - 60k




Your Responsibilities:

Defining and implementing requirements for the design and operation of an XML database.
Conducting formal and content analysis of structured documents intended for storage in the database.
Developing and implementing validation routines and search functionalities within the database.
Supporting companies in standardization-related processes by delivering high-quality, efficient standards information.




Your Qualifications:

Completed degree in information science, documentation, computer science, IT, or a similar field.
Strong knowledge of database systems, architectures, and maintenance (NoSQL, SQL).
Baseline proficiency in programming: Java or Python.
Understanding of web services, service-oriented architectures, and associated technologies (HTML, HTTP, REST, JSON).
Very nice to have: XML technologies (XML, XPath, XSL, XQuery), but not essential.
Excellent problem-solving skills and a talent for developing innovative solutions.
Ability to collaborate across teams, combined with initiative and a results-oriented approach.
Strong written and verbal communication skills in both German and English.




What We Offer:

35-hour workweek (full-time).
Maxi-Flex option: Possibility to increase weekly hours to a maximum of 42 hours/week.
Flexible working hours
Remote working opportunities.
30 vacation days per year, plus company holidays between Christmas and New Year.
Centrally located offices
Access to onsite physiotherapy, subsidies for VBB company tickets, JobRad options, sabbatical opportunities, a subsidized company restaurant, company pension plans, and more.
Comprehensive onboarding, training, and ongoing support.

Show more

Title: Market Intelligence Specialist (m/f/d)
Description:
Requisition Number: 64998

Corning is vital to progress – in the industries we help shape and in the world we share.

We invent life-changing technologies using materials science. Our scientific and manufacturing expertise, boundless curiosity, and commitment to purposeful invention place us at the center of the way the world interacts, works, learns, and lives.

Our sustained investment in research, development, and invention means we’re always ready to solve the toughest challenges alongside our customers.

Our Optical Communications segment has recently evolved from being a manufacturer of optical fiber and cable, hardware and equipment to being a comprehensive provider of industry-leading optical solutions across the broader communications industry.This segment is classified into two main product groupings – carrier network and enterprise network. The carrier network product group consists primarily of products and solutions for optical-based communications infrastructure for services such as video, data and voice communications. The enterprise network product group consists primarily of optical-based communication networks sold to businesses, governments and individuals for their own use.

For our Berlin Headquarter (or Strykow, Poland) we are currently looking for a

Market Intelligence Specialist (m/f/d)

Responsibilities


Analyze news quickly to uncover and disseminate meaningful insights on market landscape.
Analyze the impact of new market and competitive developments affecting Corning.
Support the EMEA MI OCS Lead in ad-hoc MI projects.
Support maintenance of MI knowledge sharing platform and mobile app. Structure, organize and maintain MI content architecture to maximize customer experience and utility. Scope covers training, marketing campaigns, leveraging usage analytics, troubleshooting, driving collaborative platform to build and exchange rich MI insights.
Strengthen linkages between the MI Team and COC’s Commercial and Business Intelligence Teams to enhance MI collaboration.
Maintain and disseminate competitor one-pagers. Collaborate with COC and MI team to chronicle key events and articulate business implications.
Monitor intelligence sources (e.g. competitors’ web sites) and assist OCS Strategy Team in compiling daily and weekly English-language market intelligence communications.
Measure usage of these market intelligence communications with quantitative statistics; use to drive continuous improvement.
Conduct secondary market research to gather relevant information from a variety of sources and integrate into competitive and market intelligence projects.
Support administrative tasks related to MI newsletters platform (create new MI newsletters, maintain search taxonomy, resolve technical issues); collaborate with external MI software provider; maintain MI Share Point and Box sites/content; maintain MI Team’s e-mail box, distribution lists, etc.
Conduct comparative analysis for competitors vs. Corning EMEA (e.g. manufacturing costs, product costs, financial analysis).


Requirements


Bachelor’s degree in Data Analytics, Finance or relevant field required. Master’s degree in Business Intelligence or Business Administration preferred.
Previous relevant job experience in Market Research, Competitive + Market Intelligence and/or Data Analytics.
Minimum 2-3 years of work experience, preferably in the telecom industry.
Strong knowledge of Market Intelligence related processes.
Good understanding of Corning Optical Communications product portfolio, target markets as well as our competitors and customers' landscape.
Fluent in English, written and spoken. Polish language skills are a benefit.
Structured and analytical thinker with excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Sound understanding of the Microsoft Office suite, especially Excel.
Quick learner; persistent, takes initiative, determined, resilient.
Experience with Power BI and AI desired.


Workplaces


Berlin, Germany or Strykow, Poland. Hybrid working conditions (2 days per week at home and 3 days in the office).


We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. To request an accommodation, please contact us at accommodations@corning.com .

  • Conduct secondary market research to gather relevant information from a variety of sources and integrate into competitive and market intelligence projects.
  • Support administrative tasks related to MI newsletters platform (create new MI newsletters, maintain search taxonomy, resolve technical issues); collaborate with external MI software provider; maintain MI Share Point and Box sites/content; maintain MI Team’s e-mail box, distribution lists, etc.
  • Conduct comparative analysis for competitors vs. Corning EMEA (e.g. manufacturing costs, product costs, financial analysis).

Requirements

  • Bachelor’s degree in Data Analytics, Finance or relevant field required. Master’s degree in Business Intelligence or Business Administration preferred.
  • Previous relevant job experience in Market Research, Competitive + Market Intelligence and/or Data Analytics.
  • Minimum 2-3 years of work experience, preferably in the telecom industry.
  • Strong knowledge of Market Intelligence related processes.
  • Good understanding of Corning Optical Communications product portfolio, target markets as well as our competitors and customers' landscape.
  • Fluent in English, written and spoken. Polish language skills are a benefit.
  • Structured and analytical thinker with excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Sound understanding of the Microsoft Office suite, especially Excel.
  • Quick learner; persistent, takes initiative, determined, resilient.
  • Experience with Power BI and AI desired.

Workplaces

  • Berlin, Germany or Strykow, Poland. Hybrid working conditions (2 days per week at home and 3 days in the office).

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. To request an accommodation, please contact us at accommodations@corning.com .

Title: Online Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.

A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:

In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.

Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

TELUS Digital AI Community

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.




Qualification Path:




No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.

Basic Requirements

Full Professional Proficiency in English & German language
Being a resident in Germany for the last 2 Years consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Germany
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software

Assessment

In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.

Equal Opportunity

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

Title: (Senior) Data Analyst - Marketing (d/f/m)
Description:
Personio's intelligent HR platform helps small and medium-sized organizations unlock the power of people by making complicated, time-consuming tasks simple and efficient. Our growing team of 1,800+ Personios across Europe and the US are building user-friendly products that delight our 14,000+ customers and their 1.5 million employees. Ready to make an impact from day one?

The Role: How you'll make an impact at Personio

This position can be hybrid from one of the following office locations: London, Munich, Dublin, Madrid, or Berlin.

We empower Personio's decision-making with advanced analytics and strategic insights, while boosting productivity through systems improvement and automation. Be part of our transformative journey in HR technology, where your contributions will shape our data-driven future.

In this pivotal role, you'll spearhead our marketing strategies, aligning them seamlessly with sales objectives to propel business success. As a Senior Marketing Data Analyst, you'll be the cornerstone of our Go-to-market department, leveraging your expertise in analysis, trend forecasting, and strategic planning to ignite innovative marketing initiatives and foster robust collaboration with our Sales team.

Role Responsibilities: What you'll do


Strategic Marketing Planning: You'll lead data-driven strategies within our Go-to-market framework, ensuring they resonate with our sales targets and organizational objectives.
Marketing Campaign Analysis: You're responsible for assessing campaign performance, optimizing for maximum ROI across various channels and regions.
Customer Segmentation and Personalization: You will execute advanced segmentation and collaborate with the GTM team for targeted marketing, boosting lead conversion and retention.
Trend Identification and Forecasting: Your role involves analyzing market trends, predicting future shifts, and offering competitive insights.
Team Leadership and Collaboration: You will mentor analysts and ensure cross-departmental cohesion, particularly with Sales and CX teams.
Report Generation and Presentation: You're tasked with creating and presenting reports that drive continuous improvement.
Budget Management: You oversee marketing KPI adjustments within our bi-annual budget review, ensuring alignment with financial and marketing goals.


Role Requirements: What you need to succeed


Experience: 4+ years in marketing analytics, with a leadership background.
Statistical Knowledge: Understanding of basic statistical models for business problem analysis.
Platform Familiarity: Skilled in Google Analytics, HubSpot, Salesforce, Marketo, Dreamdata, and Snowflake.
Data-Driven Leadership: Experience in fostering a data-centric culture and making data-based decisions.
Analytical Mindset: Intellectual curiosity to delve into data, identifying trends, patterns, and actionable insights.
Communication Skills: Ability to simplify complex data insights for diverse stakeholders.
Entrepreneurial Approach: Proactive problem-solving, focusing on impactful results and leveraging data insights for tangible improvements.


Why Personio

Personio is an equal opportunities employer, committed to building an integrative culture where everyone feels welcomed and supported. We embrace uniqueness and understand that our diverse, values-driven culture makes us stronger. We are proud to have an inclusive workplace environment that will foster your development no matter your gender, civil status, family status, sexual orientation, religion, age, disability, education level, or race.

Aside from our people, culture, and mission, check out some of the other benefits that make Personio a great place to work:


Receive a competitive reward package – reevaluated each year – that includes salary, benefits, and pre-IPO equity
Enjoy 28 days of paid vacation, plus an additional day after 2 and 4 years
Make an impact on the environment and society with 1 Impact Day per year
Receive generous family leave, child support, mental health support, and sabbatical opportunities
We follow an office-led, remote-friendly approach, including opportunities to work from home and international locations. Many of our teams have designated days for gathering in the office to enhance collaboration and foster a sense of community.
We enjoy gathering for meals, cultural initiatives, and events like local Summer Sessions and year-end celebrations. There's also healthy snacks, drinks, and a weekly catered lunch.

Title: Senior Data Analyst, Marketing Analytics
Description:
About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, people from all over the world have booked more than 200 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 800 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team mission

The Analytics team's mission is to enable the organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel, from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement, and take pride in the insights we generate.

This specific position is within our Marketing Analytics (Attribution & Paid Search) and will focus mostly on helping optimize our Paid Search operations and scaling our investments towards the most incremental and loyal customers. The analyst will need to intervene in our campaign setup and bidding strategies and our attribution and experimentation solutions.

You Will


Develop quantitative analysis and statistical models to evaluate and steer marketing decisions
Maintain and improve our marketing measurement tools (Attribution, experimentation framework, Customer lifetime value…)
Explore large datasets, give meaning to data and numbers, identify opportunities and issues, and present findings to stakeholders
Develop new methodologies to scale our Display and Partnerships channel, among others
Serve as a liaison between the marketing teams and the data engineering team
Mentor others in the skills needed for this role


Who You Are


5+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
Strong knowledge of SQL and Python for analysis (eg, pandas, scikit-learn, pyspark)
Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers and a track record in sharing insights to business stakeholders
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks, Databricks)
Prior exposure to digital and performance marketing
Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction and with highly engaged individuals
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English


Nice to have


Knowledge or previous experience of attribution and paid search.
Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus


How We Set You Up For Success


Meaningful work that helps create memorable travel experiences
A diverse, inclusive environment where your voice is valued
Collaboration with smart, engaged colleagues from over 80 nationalities
English-speaking office environment
Continuous learning opportunities through monthly Hackathons, weekly tech talks, and an annual external training budget
Mentorship programs to support your growth and career development
Flexible working arrangements to support work-life balance
Well-stocked kitchen and team-building events like our famous pizza & beer Fridays
GetYourGuide vouchers and free German lessons
Relocation assistance if needed


And more...

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst (0 Experience Required)
Description:
For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.




At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.




As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.




With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.




So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!




Benefits

Work up to 20 hours per week.
Earn a competitive rate of pay.
Develop your research skills.
Avoid the long commute.
Work from the comfort of your home office.
Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!




Ideal Candidate

Fluent in English and German.
Excellent research skills.
Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Germany.
Analytical mindset.




Job Requirements

Must be living in Germany for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.







Apply Online Today!

Title: Quantitative Analyst
Description:
Charles Levick have partnered with a market leader within the Energy Trading space, We have been commissioned to find a highly motivated Quantitative Analyst as they continue to expand their ever growing team.




Your role & responsibilities

Conduct quantitative analysis of the European energy market and its price drivers.
Provide traders with quantitative insights into market dynamics (e.g., through volatilities, sensitivities, and correlations).
Develop and apply mathematical models and tools to support commercial decision-making in areas such as product pricing, hedging, position management, and market analytics.
Collaborate closely with IT to refactor the existing framework for dispatch optimisation, covering all relevant timeframes from day-ahead to three years ahead.
Analyse, calibrate, and enhance quantitative models used for options trading and the green power sector.
Foster effective working relationships with traders, fellow analysts, and colleagues from risk management and other departments to ensure the smooth flow of information and informed decision-making.




Must Have

2+ years of experience in quantitative analysis, in energy trading or a related field.
Completed education in physics, mathematics, computer science, engineering, or economics at the master's, diploma, or PhD level.
Strong quantitative and analytical skills, with a deep understanding of stochastic calculus, optimisation methods, and data science techniques.
Experience in quantitative modeling and pricing of commodity options and PPA products is a plus.
Advanced proficiency in object-oriented programming (preferably in Python).
Experience with modern cloud IT technologies (e.g., GitLab CI/CD, Docker, Kubernetes, AWS) is a plus.
A team player with excellent communication and problem-solving abilities.
Proactive, entrepreneurial mindset with a strong focus on results, commercial awareness, and the ability to work independently under pressure.
Proficient in written and spoken English; knowledge of additional languages is a plus.




Benefits & Package

Highly competitive salary
Lucrative bonus package
30 days of vacation entitlement
Health Care
Diverse training opportunities
Hybrid role







If this sounds like you, or something you wish to explore further, don't hesitate to reach out or apply:




Thanks,

Hamish

Title: Reference Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
WELCOME TO BASF

We are BASF in agriculture and everything we do, we do for the love of farming. Connecting seeds and traits, crop protection products, digital tools and sustainability approaches, to help deliver the best possible outcomes for farmers, growers and our other stakeholders along the value chain. We do everything in our power to build a sustainable future for agriculture by connecting innovation, customers and society. #ForTheLoveOfFarming #TheBiggestJobOnEarth

Take a look at our Agricultural Solutions vision & mission here.


What You Can Expect

Reference data comprises standardized identifiers and attributes that classify and define other data within a database, thereby ensuring consistency and accuracy. It is essential for maintaining data integrity, reporting, and analytics within a business context, promoting a consistent understanding throughout the organization. Join our Agricultural Solutions Team in Berlin and support us as a Reference Data Specialis.


You ensure transparency, accuracy and consistency of reference data and promote the adoption of industry standards in the organization.
In addition, you collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business necessities and integrate reference data into systems and applications.
You design data models that facilitate the adoption of reference data sets and hierarchies.
You analyze reference data for trends and discrepancies, report findings and propose solutions to stakeholders.
Furthermore, you provide user support and training on reference data management best practices.
You create and maintain documentation for reference data definitions and processes.




What You Offer


Bachelor’s degree in a scientific field such as Chemistry, Environmental Sciences, Agronomy or related fields
previous experience with data management related topics
Background in IT-related field (e.g. business informatics, data management)
Knowledge and/or experience in Agricultural business and or Chemical industry is an advantage
Experience with PowerBI, SQL, Python or entity relational databases
fluent in English and German with high communication skills




What We Offer


30 days of paid vacation, special leave and sabbatical options.
Location-independent work models with defined days of presence in Berlin and place of residence in Germany.
Subsidy for public transport, personal employee benefit card and other discounts.
Flexible working hours so that you can organize your working and private life according to your needs.
Gross annual salary (full-time): 39.000 - 52.000 €, depending on qualification and work experience. In addition, you can expect a bonus dependent on the company's success as well as individual performance.




How To Reach Us


Viktoria Pohl (Talent Acquisition), viktoria.pohl@basf.com, Tel.:+49 30 2005 58390 will be happy to answer your questions for this position
You can also reach our recruiting team here
First information about our application process can be found here




About Us

As an international service hub, the BASF Services Europe GmbH bundles a wide range of services for the BASF Group throughout Europe. In the heart of Berlin, we combine expertise in the areas of finance, HR, supply chain, procurement, product safety and IT. We focus on digital and customer-focused solutions, to create services for future. Learn more about us and our career opportunities at basf.com/servicehub-berlin.

Diversity is our greatest strength!

Become a part of our winning formula for success and develop the future with us - in a global team that embraces inclusion and equal opportunities irrespective of gender, age, origin, sexual orientation, disability or belief.
Show more

We are BASF in agriculture and everything we do, we do for the love of farming. Connecting seeds and traits, crop protection products, digital tools and sustainability approaches, to help deliver the best possible outcomes for farmers, growers and our other stakeholders along the value chain. We do everything in our power to build a sustainable future for agriculture by connecting innovation, customers and society. #ForTheLoveOfFarming #TheBiggestJobOnEarth

Take a look at our Agricultural Solutions vision & mission here.


What You Can Expect

Reference data comprises standardized identifiers and attributes that classify and define other data within a database, thereby ensuring consistency and accuracy. It is essential for maintaining data integrity, reporting, and analytics within a business context, promoting a consistent understanding throughout the organization. Join our Agricultural Solutions Team in Berlin and support us as a Reference Data Specialis.

  • You ensure transparency, accuracy and consistency of reference data and promote the adoption of industry standards in the organization.
  • In addition, you collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business necessities and integrate reference data into systems and applications.
  • You design data models that facilitate the adoption of reference data sets and hierarchies.
  • You analyze reference data for trends and discrepancies, report findings and propose solutions to stakeholders.
  • Furthermore, you provide user support and training on reference data management best practices.
  • You create and maintain documentation for reference data definitions and processes.



What You Offer

  • Bachelor’s degree in a scientific field such as Chemistry, Environmental Sciences, Agronomy or related fields
  • previous experience with data management related topics
  • Background in IT-related field (e.g. business informatics, data management)
  • Knowledge and/or experience in Agricultural business and or Chemical industry is an advantage
  • Experience with PowerBI, SQL, Python or entity relational databases
  • fluent in English and German with high communication skills



What We Offer

  • 30 days of paid vacation, special leave and sabbatical options.
  • Location-independent work models with defined days of presence in Berlin and place of residence in Germany.
  • Subsidy for public transport, personal employee benefit card and other discounts.
  • Flexible working hours so that you can organize your working and private life according to your needs.
  • Gross annual salary (full-time): 39.000 - 52.000 €, depending on qualification and work experience. In addition, you can expect a bonus dependent on the company's success as well as individual performance.



How To Reach Us

  • Viktoria Pohl (Talent Acquisition), viktoria.pohl@basf.com, Tel.:+49 30 2005 58390 will be happy to answer your questions for this position
  • You can also reach our recruiting team here
  • First information about our application process can be found here



About Us

As an international service hub, the BASF Services Europe GmbH bundles a wide range of services for the BASF Group throughout Europe. In the heart of Berlin, we combine expertise in the areas of finance, HR, supply chain, procurement, product safety and IT. We focus on digital and customer-focused solutions, to create services for future. Learn more about us and our career opportunities at basf.com/servicehub-berlin.

Diversity is our greatest strength!

Become a part of our winning formula for success and develop the future with us - in a global team that embraces inclusion and equal opportunities irrespective of gender, age, origin, sexual orientation, disability or belief.

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
PAUL Tech AG is a technology leader in the real estate industry with the mission to make buildings carbon neutral. Our proprietary technology, consisting of IoT-enabled hardware and AI-supported software, permanently optimizes water-bearing systems in buildings. This reduces CO2 emissions and energy costs. Everyone benefits: owners, operators, occupants and the climate. At Paul, we are researchers, developers and practitioners with the common goal of developing intelligent solutions for buildings to combat climate change.

Therefore we are looking for you to drive our scaling as

Data Analyst (m/f/d) in Berlin

Core Responsibilities

Strategic Stakeholder Collaboration


Partner and collaborate closely with business stakeholders to understand their strategies, needs, and objectives



Analytical Problem Framing


Analytical outlook to frame the right questions while diving deep into business domains and processes



Data Integration and Collaboration


Connect data from various sources, collaborating with product managers and engineers to develop comprehensive data solutions



Data Model Development


Develop robust and clean data models, ensuring high-quality data thereby leading high-quality analytics



Insightful Data Communication


Communicate insights in a compelling and accessible manner to support product development and decision-making



Data-Driven Decision Support


Support the business decision-making process, by generating analytical solutions by leveraging exploratory data analysis and hypothesis based “proof of concept” framework



The Skillset We Are Looking For


Proven experience in data analysis, preferably within a business context
Strong zeal for Data crunching and wrangling
Proficiency in SQL and/or Python for data analysis and modeling
Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI or Tableau
A proactive and collaborative mindset, with the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to articulate complex ideas
A passion for learning, hands-on work, taking ownership, and making an impact



What You Can Expect From Us


A meaningful job that contributes to global CO2 savings
A collegial working atmosphere with short decision paths
A permanent contract with an above-average salary
30 days vacation per calendar year plus 24.12. and 31.12. off
Company private health insurance and supplementary pension
Company fitness subsidy in your region
Regular company events to which you are very welcome
Tram ticket as well as drinks and fruit in our offices



Would you like to become part of us? Then apply here.

Title: Principal Data Analyst
Description:
About Fit Analytics Innovation




Fit Analytics Innovation is a leading technology company specializing in innovative and sustainable solutions for the retail industry, based in Berlin and Chicago. Our mission is to revolutionize the online shopping experience by providing accurate sizing and fit recommendations, ultimately reducing returns and enhancing customer satisfaction.




As a trusted partner for e-commerce platforms and retailers, Fit Analytics is dedicated to revolutionizing the online shopping journey. By seamlessly integrating our sizing technology, we empower customers to make informed choices, leading to a more efficient and enjoyable shopping experience.




Our cutting-edge AI solution - Fit Finder - delivers precise size recommendations tailored to individual customers. Our machine learning technology takes brand-specific sizing variations and individual body measurements into account, ensuring a personalized and reliable fit for each shopper.




Our team members come from all around the world, creating a global collective of passionate domain experts dedicated to solving sizing for our partners and their shoppers.







Role Overview:




Embark on an exciting journey with Fit Analytics Innovation as a Principal Product Analyst from our Berlin office, where you'll play a critical leadership role in driving the success of our cutting-edge sizing and fit recommendation solutions.




As a seasoned professional, you will drive strategic decision-making and execution while providing mentorship and thought leadership across the organization. You will lead complex data-driven initiatives, optimize client implementation and performance, and spearhead the ideation and development of advanced insights tools.




Additionally, you will own the vision and delivery of our data science products ensuring alignment with broader business objectives. Your responsibilities will encompass everything from creating and executing A/B test programs to driving performance upgrade projects and driving reporting processes and automation, all while providing invaluable insights that contribute to improving and optimizing every stage of our product development and delivery process.







Key Responsibilities:




Showcase and exemplify to team members a high level of expertise in conducting investigative tasks, providing hands-on support to help clients understand performance and areas for improvement through effective data storytelling. Utilize analytical skills to delve deep into data, ensuring a comprehensive understanding of client needs and challenges.




Proactively generate actionable insights aimed at improving our performance, processes and product features. Employ a data-driven mindset to identify opportunities for continuous optimization and innovation.




Lead the inception and implementation of A/B test programs, demonstrating a clear Return on Investment (ROI), and aligning initiatives with our overarching product vision in close collaboration with our data science and product teams.




Lead tooling and reporting automation initiatives to streamline and enhance accurate, data-centric decision-making in order to ensure a seamless alignment with business objectives.







Requirements and Qualifications:




7-12 years of experience in a product analytics or related role.




Expert proficient in SQL and python.




Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a proven ability to generate actionable business strategies.




Proven expertise in A/B testing, data analysis, and experimental design.




Excellent communication and storytelling abilities to convey complex analytical findings effectively to diverse stakeholders.




Hands-on experience with data visualization tools and a deep understanding of data science concepts.




Demonstrated ability to drive innovation and continuous improvement in product analytics processes.




Prior experience in designing and optimizing data pipelines and ETL processes is a strong plus.

Title: Product Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Company Description

Flink is the leading quick commerce player in Europe. We are on a mission to give people back time: You can order your groceries through our app and we deliver to your doorstep in minutes. We carry 3,000 products with a focus on the leading brands in each category. We aim for sustainability by making deliveries on electric bikes and utilizing recyclable packaging.

Flink launched in February 2021 and already operates in more than 90 cities in Germany, and the Netherlands. The business generated more than EUR 400m in revenues in 2022 and is operationally profitable. Flink is backed by the world’s most renowned tech investors, including Prosus, Mubadala, and Bond, and strategic investors like Doordash and REWE. We take great pride in being an inclusive employer that offers equal opportunities, and we celebrate the diversity and multiculturalism of our team. We're growing fast and always pushing ourselves to do better - we play for #1.

In your role as a Product Analyst (m/f/d), you will work closely with cross-functional Product teams and drive their decision-making and product development with your analytical work.

Job Description


Develop a deep understanding of user behavior in the exciting field of instant grocery delivery and influence our Product roadmap to continually improve our user experience;
Develop and evolve tracking concepts to ensure we collect accurate and reliable data
Build and transform raw event stream data from various sources into our warehouse and therefore enable driving actionable insights & enriching user profiles;
Analyse our conversion funnels in order to understand user behavior and optimize conversion rates;
Design, conduct and evaluate A/B tests and drive experimentation-led Product development.


Qualifications


Proven experience in an analytical role (e.g. Product Analyst / Data Analyst)
Experience with modern SQL databases (preferably Google BigQuery or Snowflake) or other analytics tooling (for example Python or R);
Experience with analytics engineering (preferably dbt) or willingness to learn
Working knowledge of basic statistics concepts
Enthusiastic about understanding user behaviour and how to build great digital (customer-centric) products;
Very good communication skills in English (spoken & written); German is a plus.


Additional Information


A €1000 annual L&D budget as well as individual coaching options to ensure you have plenty of opportunities to learn, grow and achieve your goals
26 days of vacation, +1 day every year up to a maximum of 30 days
A mobility budget of 30 EUR per month with NAVIT, which you can use individually for Uber, BVG and many other providers
A cool discount on your Urban Sports Club membership
Attractive company pension options
Unlimited access to an e-learning and development platform, MyAcademy, including online German courses
Online discounts with Corporate Benefits and Future Bens
A cool discount off your personal Flink orders; be the first to test out new products!
A modern and dog-friendly office in the heart of Berlin - lots of delicious lunch spots available within short walking distance


It is our commitment that every applicant will be evaluated according to their skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion.

Title: Staff Data Analyst, DATA (m/f/d)
Description:
The role

Our Behavioral Data Squad is a cross-functional team with end-to-end ownership of digital tracking across all markets globally at HelloFresh, from infrastructure all the way to the curated data products. As our Staff Data Analyst, you will play an integral part in ensuring data quality, governance and observability by defining and building the metrics, visualisations, and targets within the squad. You will also be a data detective, deep diving into root cause analyses of tracking discrepancies or anomalous readings, to further drive up trust and adoption.

If you are an expert analyst and a self-starter, with the product-sense to create effective success metrics and use these to inspire trust in a global business, this could be the role for you. Your deep understanding of behavioural tracking infrastructure and data models enables you to identify needs and pain points across Data Infrastructure, Platform, Engineering and Analytics, and defining solutions to constantly improve the way we work. So while you are an individual contributor, you are a key owner of best practices across our teams.

What You’ll Do


Accountable for your teams’ data catalogue and delivery documentation
Collaborate from a technical perspective with data product managers and data engineers to create reusable data products
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and define project objectives while utilising project management skills to plan and execute data-driven projects
Partner widely across the Senior Product organisation (Product, Software Engineering, UX leads) to set strategic priorities and promote a culture rooted in evidence-based decision making.
Communicate actionable insights clearly across the organisation highlighting the “so-whats” of your analyses in order to drive the growth of our business.
Explore and analyse customer behaviour and product performance data in order to detect growth opportunities for the HelloFresh digital product by improving user experience.
Guide and mentor other Product Analysts within our team, defining best practices and providing support to help individuals and the team grow in effectiveness
Review as a technical expert the implementations of multiple teams across domains, continuously improving the deliverables of your teams


What You'll Bring


Extensive experience in quantitative analysis roles, ideally including having worked closely with product teams for at least 5 years.
Excellent technical skills applying expert level SQL and Python for both analysis and efficient manipulation of large data sets.
Expert level knowledge of data visualisation tools like Tableau which we use to create compelling visualisations to convey complex data.
Extensive experience working with product stakeholders in setting up A|B experiments, interpreting results and deep diving to understand the impact of particular experiments.
Excellent communication skills, taking complex business problems, articulating these as analytical problems and presenting your findings in a clear and precise way.
Extensive leadership of complex projects you have led, capability building within your team, and through mentorship or direct people management.
A change mindset, the status quo is not an impediment
You are outcome oriented, and can take a business challenge, create actionable analytical insights against it, and align stakeholders on actions to create business value.


What We Offer

Elevate your lifestyle! Join one of Europe's fastest-growing tech powerhouses in a dynamic phase of expansion.


Immerse yourself in a diverse global community of 90+ nationalities.
Enjoy a competitive compensation package that goes beyond the norm, with perks like a HelloFresh- subsidized Pension Scheme, Berlin relocation support, and a Hybrid working model.
Elevate your lifestyle with exclusive discounts on your weekly HelloFresh box and office meals.
Invest in your growth with an annual learning & development budget, German language learning budget, and access to the HelloFresh Academy.
Plus, we've got your well-being covered with mental health support, transportation perks, and working-parent-friendly benefits. From our 24/7 gym access,wellbeing platforms like Headspace and Spill, to sabbatical leave options, HelloFresh is not just a workplace; it's a lifestyle of perks and possibilities!


#Data

Are you up for the challenge?

Please submit your complete application below including your salary expectations and earliest starting date.

After submitting an application our team will review this and get back to you within 5 business days.

For insight into our interview process take a look at our recent post here

JR102528
