Title: Analytics Specialist
Description:
About Deep Trekker:

Deep Trekker is a global leader in providing innovative underwater robotics solutions for diverse industries, including aquaculture, infrastructure inspection, public safety, and environmental monitoring. Our cutting-edge products empower professionals to tackle challenging underwater environments with confidence and precision.




As part of our mission to deliver world-class solutions, we are looking for a Data Analytics Specialist to join our team and help us harness the power of data to drive decision-making, improve customer experiences, and optimize business performance.




About the Role:

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Data Analytics Specialist to take ownership of our data strategy and implementation. In this role, you will play a pivotal role in managing analytics platforms, providing actionable insights, and ensuring data accuracy and reliability. You’ll collaborate across teams to support strategic decision-making and deliver impactful data-driven solutions.




Key Responsibilities:




Analytics Strategy & Implementation:

Act as the primary expert in Google Analytics 4 (GA4), overseeing its implementation, configuration, and management.
Conduct comprehensive audits of analytics setups and recommend optimization strategies to enhance data quality and tracking.
Manage and maintain Google Tag Manager (GTM) to ensure robust and accurate tracking across platforms.
Develop and maintain documentation, including tracking specifications, dashboards, and reporting frameworks.
Synthesize data from multiple sources (e.g., CRM, marketing platforms, sales data) to provide a comprehensive view of performance.




Insights, Analysis & Reporting:

Analyze user behavior, conversion funnels, and customer journeys to identify opportunities for growth and optimization.
Design and deliver dashboards, reports, and visualizations tailored to stakeholders across the organization.
Monitor KPIs and provide actionable recommendations to improve business outcomes.
Regularly present insights and findings to technical and non-technical audiences.




Optimization & Testing:

Collaborate with marketing, sales, and product teams on A/B testing initiatives, providing data-driven analysis and recommendations.
Ensure accurate tracking of experiments and seamless measurement of results.
Partner with marketing to iterate on campaigns and strategies based on data-driven outcomes.




Requirements:

2+ years of experience with Google Analytics 4 (GA4), including implementation, configuration, and reporting.
4+ years of experience in data analytics, with expertise in digital analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics, Mixpanel, or similar platforms).
Advanced knowledge of Google Tag Manager (GTM) for implementing and managing tracking solutions.
Familiarity with A/B testing and optimization platforms (e.g., Optimizely) is a strong asset.
Solid understanding of digital marketing, customer journeys, and conversion optimization.
Excellent analytical and communication skills, with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.
Google Analytics certifications or similar credentials (required).




What Makes You Stand Out:

Previous experience in enterprise technology environments, especially within search, content, or document management systems.
Knowledge of Salesforce Cloud, ServiceNow, Adobe, or Sitecore will be advantageous.
You don’t need to tick every box; if you're passionate and think you can bring a new perspective to the role, we encourage you to apply.




Nice to Have:

Experience with tools like Hyros, Tableau, or Power BI.
Familiarity with CRM platforms and sales analytics.
Exposure to data integration and ETL tools.




What We Offer:

A chance to work with a dynamic and innovative team shaping the future of underwater robotics
Competitive salary and benefits package
Opportunities for professional development and growth
Flexible work options
RRSP matching




Dive into Deep Trekker!

At Deep Trekker, we believe in empowering our team to explore new depths of innovation and efficiency. We are committed to fostering a culture where diversity and unique perspectives are valued and celebrated. We encourage all qualified candidates to apply, regardless of age, gender identity, disability, or ethnic background. Join us in pushing the boundaries of underwater exploration and technology.




Thank you for considering a career at Deep Trekker. We are excited to see how you can make waves with us!

Show more

Title: Data and Reporting Analyst
Description:
Title: Data and Reporting Analyst - Home Financing Product & Campaign Analytics

Duration: 12+ Months (High possibility of Extension and Conversion)

Location: Toronto, ON M5G 3C2 (Hybrid - 2 days in office per week, Mondays/Wednesdays preferred)

LOB: Home Financing




Role Mandate:

The selected candidates will consult on analytical solutions to understand, analyze, and synthesize requirements, goals, and objectives relative to data and business intelligence needs and to enable high-quality, fact-based business decisions to drive better business outcomes. Provides advice on the configuration, functionality, applicability, and usability of data management, data analytics, and data visualization technology solutions. Supports the development of the strategy and roadmap for data quality and data analytics, reporting, business intelligence, and the design and development of sophisticated decision support tools.




Role Responsibilities Include (but are not limited to):

Acts as a trusted advisor to assigned business/group.
Leads the design, development, and implementation of analytic solutions.
Identifies emerging issues and trends to inform decision-making.
Recommends and implements solutions based on analysis of issues and implications for the business
Ensures alignment between stakeholders about business needs and data needs.
Leads/participates in the design, implementation, and management of new analytics & reporting solutions.
Designs, develops, and implements innovative analytical solutions.
Designs and produces regular and ad-hoc reports, and dashboards.
Breaks down strategic problems, and analyses data and information to provide subject matter insights and recommendations.
Structures and assembles data into multi-dimensions with various granularities (e.g., demographics, customers, products, transactions).
Cleanses, manipulates, and transforms data through programming / scripting for model training and validation.
Automates validation tests to improve quality and efficiency of the validation process.
Validates and tests models used in analytics and reporting to assess/address performance and compliance.
Promotes reporting automation, self-serve analytics consumption, and the culture of analytics-driven decision making.
Monitors and tracks tool performance, user acceptance testing, and addresses any issues.
Integrates information from multiple sources to enable more efficient processes, enhanced analysis and/or streamlined reporting.
Designs, develops, and implements innovative analytical solutions.
Designs and produces regular and ad-hoc reports, and dashboards.
Builds reports and visualizations to effectively communicate data driven insights to users for a variety of audiences e.g. visualization solutions of data into reports, graphics, dashboards to illustrate facts, trends, and insights.
Develops solutions and makes recommendations based on an understanding of the business strategy and stakeholder needs.
Supports development and execution of strategic analytics & reporting initiatives in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders.
Analyzes data and information to provide subject-matter insights and recommendations.
Develops tools and delivers training programs for use of reporting tools and self-serve analytics by non-analytical end users; may include delivery of training to audiences.
Documents and maintain operational procedures and processes relating to analytical and reporting processes.
Builds effective relationships with internal/external stakeholders.
Collaborates with internal and external stakeholders to deliver on business objectives.
Focus is primarily on business/group within Client; may have broader, enterprise-wide focus.
Provides specialized consulting, analytical and technical support.
Exercises judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given rules.
Works independently and regularly handles non-routine situations.
Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed.




Must-Have Skills:

5+ years of relevant data analytics experience
Relevant degree (stats, data, analytics) preferred.
RESL analytics experience would be a definite asset.
Advanced product knowledge for the designated business / portfolio.
Previous knowledge of home financing, HELOC’s, mortgages (particularly in banking setting) a strong asset
Knowledge and experience in data preparation, data analysis, and statistical tool sets including but not limited to SQL, SAS (certified), R, Python, PowerBI, PowerPoint.
Deep knowledge and technical proficiency gained through extensive education and business experience.
Verbal & written communication skills - In-depth.
Collaboration & team skills - In-depth.
Analytical and problem-solving skills - In-depth.
Influence skills - In-depth.
Data driven decision making - In-depth.
Understanding of measurement techniques (a/b testing, treatment control framework)
Data mining, data storytelling and data visualization

Title: Staff Data Analyst, Core Experience
Description:
TextNow is looking for an experienced Staff Data Analyst to fuel the next stage of our growth. This person will work closely with cross-functional stakeholders to deliver analytics & insights that helpbuild and deliver an awesome, high quality and intuitive consumer app and communications platform that enables and excites our customers to connect with anyone, without the barriers of cost or complexity.

What You’ll Do


Be a strong partner to cross-functional teams in understanding the extent and severity our users’ pain points, especially through quantitative methods & approaches.
Provide cross-functional teams visibility into key business KPIs and metrics by developing and presenting reports and dashboards.
Independently conduct analyses using rigorous analytic methods and build recommendations that drive decision making and business prioritization
Execute upon experimentation roadmaps by implementing experiments and tests, monitoring results and presenting recommendations
Generate and share actionable insights with Director+ level leadership via written artifacts such as decks and memos, and verbally in forums such as weekly standup meetings.


Who You Are


BA/BS in a quantitative discipline like Math, Computer Science, Economics or Analytics required. MS in Business Analytics highly preferred.
8+ years of hands-on experience in business and/or product analytics, working with large, multi-dimensional datasets, preferably at fast-growing tech companies.
Exceptional communication skills, both verbal and written.
Skilled in extracting and transforming data from Snowflake warehouse using SQL
Hands-on experience in designing, building, operating, and maintaining Tableau dashboards
Knowledge of consumer app businesses and familiarity with concepts such as NPS is preferred.
Experience in experimentation (A/B tests, geo tests etc.) and basic statistics (e.g hypothesis testing) required.
Knowledge of commonly used analytic methods such as regression, decision trees and forecasting is highly preferred.
Experience in and ability to play “trusted advisor” to senior and executive leadership and help make change happen.
Fast learner.
Being a fast learner also means the ability to admit defeat, ask for help and iterate quickly so you can learn from your mistakes and move ahead.
Respectfully candid with the ability to collaborate with multiple stakeholders as well as peers on the data team
Resourceful and scrappy with the ability to deliver insights to the right teams in a timely manner.


More about TextNow...

Our Values


Customer Obsessed (We strive to have a deep understanding of our customers)
Do Right By Our People (We treat each other with fairness, respect, and integrity)
Accept the Challenge (We adopt a "Yes, We Can" mindset to achieve ambitious goals)
Act Like an Owner (We treat this company like it's our own... because it is!)
Give a Damn! (We are deeply committed and passionate about our work and achieving results)


Benefits, Culture, & More


Strong work life blend
Flexible work arrangements (wfh, remote, or access to one of our office spaces)
Employee Stock Options
Unlimited vacation
Competitive pay and benefits
Parental leave
Benefits for both physical and mental well being (wellness credit and L&D credit)
We travel a few times a year for various team events, company wide off-sites, and more


Diversity And Inclusion

At TextNow, our mission is built around inclusion and offering a service for EVERYONE, in an industry that traditionally only caters to the few who have the means to afford it. We believe that diversity of thought and inclusion of others promotes a greater feeling of belonging and higher levels of engagement. We know that if we work together, we can do amazing things, and that our differences are what make our product and company great.

TextNow Candidate Policy

By submitting an application to TextNow, you agree to the collection, use, and disclosure of your personal information in accordance with the TextNow Candidate Policy

HTML:
TextNow is looking for an experienced Staff Data Analyst to fuel the next stage of our growth. This person will work closely with cross-functional stakeholders to deliver analytics & insights that helpbuild and deliver an awesome, high quality and intuitive consumer app and communications platform that enables and excites our customers to connect with anyone, without the barriers of cost or complexity.

What You’ll Do

  • Be a strong partner to cross-functional teams in understanding the extent and severity our users’ pain points, especially through quantitative methods & approaches.
  • Provide cross-functional teams visibility into key business KPIs and metrics by developing and presenting reports and dashboards.
  • Independently conduct analyses using rigorous analytic methods and build recommendations that drive decision making and business prioritization
  • Execute upon experimentation roadmaps by implementing experiments and tests, monitoring results and presenting recommendations
  • Generate and share actionable insights with Director+ level leadership via written artifacts such as decks and memos, and verbally in forums such as weekly standup meetings.

Who You Are

  • BA/BS in a quantitative discipline like Math, Computer Science, Economics or Analytics required. MS in Business Analytics highly preferred.
  • 8+ years of hands-on experience in business and/or product analytics, working with large, multi-dimensional datasets, preferably at fast-growing tech companies.
  • Exceptional communication skills, both verbal and written.
  • Skilled in extracting and transforming data from Snowflake warehouse using SQL
  • Hands-on experience in designing, building, operating, and maintaining Tableau dashboards
  • Knowledge of consumer app businesses and familiarity with concepts such as NPS is preferred.
  • Experience in experimentation (A/B tests, geo tests etc.) and basic statistics (e.g hypothesis testing) required.

Title: Research & Insights Associate Canada
Description:
About Fanduel

FanDuel Group is the premier mobile gaming company in the United States. FanDuel Group consists of a portfolio of leading brands across mobile wagering including: America’s #1 Sportsbook, FanDuel Sportsbook; its leading iGaming platform, FanDuel Casino; the industry’s unquestioned leader in horse racing and advance-deposit wagering, FanDuel Racing; and its daily fantasy sports product.

In addition, FanDuel Group operates FanDuel TV, its broadly distributed linear cable television network and FanDuel TV+, its leading direct-to-consumer OTT platform. FanDuel Group has a presence across all 50 states and Puerto Rico.

The company is based in New York with US offices in Los Angeles, Atlanta, and Jersey City, as well as global offices in Canada and Scotland. The company’s affiliates have offices worldwide, including in Ireland, Portugal, Romania, and Australia.

FanDuel Group is a subsidiary of Flutter Entertainment, the world's largest sports betting and gaming operator with a portfolio of globally recognized brands and traded on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE: FLUT).

THE POSITION

Our roster has an opening with your name on it

We are currently looking for a research and insights associate to join our FanDuel Canada team! In this role, you will be responsible for conducting deep analysis of internal customer and external consumer data, forming data points into insights, and building sharp reports across Sportsbook and Casino verticals. You will also work closely with various stakeholders within the commercial, marketing, and product teams, while building and maintaining relationships with various external agency partners.

THE GAME PLAN

Everyone on our team has a part to play


Analyze large sets of data to identify key trends and insights
Support the execution of FanDuel customer surveys including writing questionnaire for the surveys, keeping track of sample completion on the dashboard, partnering with the agency and regular reporting of the data
Assist in creating presentations and reports for monthly, quarterly scorecards and adhoc studies/requests
Stay on the pulse with monthly and quarterly brand performance reports
Work closely with external partners on brand track project and adhoc studies
Stay up to date with the trends in our industry as well as monitoring competitor activity
Be organized and attentive to details
Work closely with brand, media and commercial team to commercialize relevant insights
Research the market, consumers, and competition to help drive decisions for our sportsbook and casino
Synthesize data and research findings into actionable recommendations for the stakeholders
Present findings and recommendations to stakeholders



THE STATS

What we're looking for in our next teammate


Degree in Marketing, Math, Finance, or other quantitative fields with a strong GPA preferred
2+ years of experience in working on primary quantitative research projects
Experience in working end to end on primary research projects
Experience in working with research agencies
Strong proficiency in PowerPoint, Excel and other data analytical tools
Basic knowledge of statistical concepts like regression, category drivers, perception analysis
Previous exposure to qualitative research considered an asset
Able to plan, organize, and prioritize multiple and simultaneous projects and assignments.
Natural curiosity to learn about consumer trends and market landscape in gambling industry
Eagerness to learn and adapt to new data visualization tools
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Strong project management skills
Highly organized and motivated
Understanding of iGaming category considered an asset
Able to navigate a highly regulated and complex industry
Knowledge of sports and/or experience working within a heavily regulated industry is a plus



Player Benefits

We treat our team right

We offer amazing benefits above and beyond the basics. We have an array of health plans to choose from (some as low as $0 per paycheck) that include programs for fertility and family planning, mental health support, and fitness benefits. We offer generous paid time off (PTO & sick leave), annual bonus and long-term incentive opportunities (based on performance), 401k with up to a 5% match, commuter benefits , pet insurance, and more - check out all our benefits here: FanDuel Total Rewards. *Benefits differ across location, role, and level.

FanDuel is an equal opportunities employer and we believe, as one of our principles states, “We are One Team!”. As such, we are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, creed, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship status, marital status, disability, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or another other characteristic protected by state, local or federal law. We believe FanDuel is strongest and best able to compete if all employees feel valued, respected, and included.

The applicable salary range for this position is $62,000 – $85,800 CAD, which is dependent on a variety of factors including relevant experience, location, business needs and market demand. We offer amazing benefits above and beyond the basics. We have an array of health plans to choose from (some as low as $0 per paycheck) that include programs for fertility and family planning, mental health support, and fitness benefits. We offer generous paid time off (PTO & sick leave), annual bonus and long-term incentive opportunities (based on performance), 401k with up to a 5% match, commuter benefits , pet insurance, and more - check out all our benefits here: FanDuel Total Rewards. *Benefits differ across location, role, and level.

FanDuel is an equal opportunities employer, and we believe, as one of our principles states, “We are One Team!”. As such, we are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, creed, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship status, marital status, disability, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or another other characteristic protected by state, local or federal law. We believe FanDuel is strongest and best able to compete if all employees feel valued, respected, and included.

Title: Technical Data Analyst
Description:
About Reach

At Reach, we believe that the global ecommerce space is ripe for disruption. Our strategic partnerships with currency exchange providers allow us to offer direct and guaranteed, real-time currency exchange rates. We want to help retailers grow; we understand global consumers and how changes in their shopping experience affect your business. At Reach, we are constantly improving to support ever-changing local markets and help serve shoppers better.

Role Overview:

We're looking for a Technical Data Analyst in our Data team to develop a deep understanding of our data in order to collaborate with various teams to consolidate documentation, standardize data diagrams, and develop comprehensive training resources. Using the latest tools and processes, we're able to maximize our offerings and deliver unparalleled service and support. The ideal candidate will be highly skilled in all aspects of technical data analysis of business requirements for the purposes of moving, transforming, reporting, documenting and enabling self-discovery, understanding and awareness of data assets to support Reach delivery teams such as BI, DS, DE, AppInt. This person should be committed to transforming business objectives into requirements that will help produce readable, goal-oriented reports and documentation that drive innovation and growth.

Key Responsibilities:


Defining, maintaining, and monitoring the data catalog, collaborating with teams to ensure information is current and accurate, and automating processes to enhance efficiency
Developing and updating high-level data models and diagrams, identifying outdated or missing visual representations, and assisting teams in creating detailed diagrams for critical data areas
Educating teams on data usage and interpretation, including training on the data catalog, and developing comprehensive training materials to support ongoing education
Establishing and documenting processes and objectives for the technical data analysis team, fostering a culture of continuous improvement and collaboration
Analyzing existing internal and external data sources and structures to inform the development of new data assets, and collaborating with Business Intelligence, Data Science, and Data Engineering teams to define data requirements for delivery layers and data marts
Translate technical understanding of data issues to business friendly communications
Collaborate with the various business team members on time sensitive client issues
Obtain a deep understanding of the Reach data systems and transactional data
Data analysis deep dives into large scale, detailed transactions



Requirements


Undergraduate degree in a related technical/analytical field (Computer Science, Data Statistics, Mathematics)
Strong SQL knowledge and practical experience working with relational databases
Experience with technical data modeling and data diagrams (ERD, dataflow, definitions)
Experience with technical writing such that complex data considerations can be expressed clearly in writing
Experience extracting data from databases, flat files, developer portals, web APIs, and programming libraries
Experience using Microsoft Excel and Google Sheets for data analysis and reporting
Strong analytical skills related to working with development tools, database technologies, APIs, structured and unstructured datasets
Experience with source control and CI/CD tools, like GitHub
Continuous improvement mindset taking initiative to research and adapt new technologies and methodologies
Excellent verbal communication and writing skills
Strong attention to detail when problem solving
Strong sense of ownership
Ability to learn new tools and technologies quickly



Additional Assets:


Practical experience with Snowflake on AWS
Work experience in a technology startup or eCommerce environment
Experience working with the Atlassian suite of tools like JIRA and Confluence
Experience with a cloud environment like GCP, Azure, AWS
Experience with reporting tools like Power BI and Sigma
Experience with data transformation tools and automations like Workato, Matillion, Snowflake automations (Snowpipe, Snowflake Tasks), DBT
Experience with project management



Our Core Values:

At Reach we believe that high performing teams all have common values and synergies that enable them to work well together. If you share some of these values then you will excel in your role on the Data team. Some of our Core Values are:


We value solving problems and building products by focusing on outcomes
We value making decisions while considering input from multiple sources
We value taking action over getting stuck in planning
We value taking chances and failing fast
We value teamwork over individual accomplishments
We value optimizing time to value and achieving outcomes, not checking boxes
We value work/life balance and a mindset of "it's a marathon, not a sprint"
We value using the right technology to solve the right problems



Benefits

Working with us, you'll not only be part of an amazing team and a fast-growing company, you'll get:

Training & Development Opportunities

Competitive salary

Flexible work environment

HSA

RRSP contribution matching

Self-Directed Career Development Plan (Annual Budget + Paid Days)

And More!

We uphold a collaborative, innovative, and detail-oriented work culture. We are looking for someone who is excited to grow with us and contribute to building scalable, accessible, and user-friendly documentation.

We are an equal opportunity employer. We encourage all qualified candidates to apply. Please note that only qualified applicants will be contacted.
Show more

Title: Senior Analyst, Analytics & Insights (Call Center & Operations)
Description:
Join a Challenger

Being a traditional bank just isn’t our thing. We are big believers in innovating the banking experience because we believe Canadians deserve better options, and we challenge ourselves and our teams to creatively transform what’s possible in banking. Our team is made up of inquisitive and agile minds that find smarter ways of doing things. If you’re not afraid of taking on big challenges and redefining the future, you belong with us. You’ll get to work with people who will encourage you to reach new heights. We like to keep things fun, ask questions and learn together.

We are a big (and growing!) family. Overall we serve more than 670,000 people across Canada through Equitable Bank, Canada's Challenger Bank™, and have been around for more than 50 years. Equitable Bank's wholly-owned subsidiary, Concentra Bank, supports credit unions across Canada that serve more than six million members. Together we have over $125 billion in combined assets under management and administration, with a clear mandate to drive change in Canadian banking to enrich people's lives. Our customers have named our EQ Bank digital platform (eqbank.ca) one of the top banks in Canada on the Forbes World's Best Banks list since 2021.

The Work

The Analytics & Insights Sr. Analyst will be responsible for owning and driving the analytical models, experimentation, and reporting for the Customer Contact Center. The individual will support strategic initiatives by delivering actionable operational insights and analytical solutions. They will partner with both business stakeholders and technical teams to ensure data accuracy and availability, generate actionable insights, create self-serve dashboards, inform best practices, and provide clear recommendations for planning and optimizing our Customer Contact Center processes. This hands-on, technical role requires foundational understanding of forecasting techniques, statistical analysis, and NLP methods to address ambiguous and open-ended business challenges.

Own Analytical Requests & Reporting Needs for Customer Contact Center (60%)


Manage all analytical requests and reporting needs, including dashboards and written updates, for Customer Contact Center
Provide analytics and insights for key monthly and quarterly meetings with executives/senior stakeholders to inform strategic decisions and investments, FY target and performance tracking.
Maintain and upgrade existing PowerBI dashboards to deliver scorecards and actionable insights across business lines from the lens of call center and Customer Contact Center.
Support weekly and day-to-day tactical planning for call center stakeholders to ensure the freshest data and forecasting for workforce planning and management.




Own the Analytical Models & Experimentation Needs for Customer Contact Center (20%)


Perform complex forecasting and measure actuals against forecasts to identify key assumption changes and correlations to measured outcomes.
Assist in bi-monthly schedule forecasting and annual headcount forecasting.
Extract and manipulate data from multiple sources to proactively structure analysis, uncover data deficiencies, and share recommendations.
Utilize statistical and NLP techniques to generate actionable insights for business problems
Guide Product Managers with clear recommendations on experiment designing and interpretation relevant to the workstream, including phased rollouts of new technologies, such as chatbots.




Product Analytics & Supporting Strategic Decisions for Customer Contact Center (20%)


Conduct root cause analysis to proactively identify customer pain points from call and chat transcript data and provide recommendations to business leaders.
Collaborate with the Data enablement and BI Lead to ensure data completeness and availability for Customer Contact Center.




Let's Talk About You!


Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Engineering, Math, or Computer Science.
3-6 years of work experience in Analytics, Strategy, Data Science roles, ideally in Financial services preferred.
Intermediate proficiency with Python and SQL, and prior experience with LLMs is required
Prior experience in Azure stack is preferred
Strong business acumen and passion for understanding and solving problems for consumers of financial services using rigorous data-driven methods and advanced analytical approaches
Experience in call center analytics projects will be a value add.
Excellent analytical, modeling and problem-solving skills.
Excellent oral and written communication skills.
Proficient in using MS Office (Excel, Access, Power Point).
Experience with databases (e.g. SQL code) and data visualization (e.g. Tableau) is an asset.
Strong attention to detail and time management skills.




What we offer [For full-time permanent roles]

💰 Competitive discretionary bonus

✨ Market leading RRSP match program

🩺 Medical, dental, vision, life, and disability benefits

📝 Employee Share Purchase Plan

👶🏽 Maternity/Parental top-up while you care for your little one

🏝 Generous vacation policy and personal days

🖥 Virtual events to connect with your fellow colleagues

🎓 Annual professional development allowance and a comprehensive Career Development program

💛 A fulfilling opportunity to join one of the top FinTechs and help create a new kind of banking experience

Equitable Bank is deeply committed to inclusion. Our organization is stronger and our employees thrive when we honour and celebrate everyone’s diverse experiences and perspectives. In tandem with that commitment, we support and encourage our staff to grow not just in their career path, but personally as well.

We commit to providing a barrier-free recruitment process and work environment for all applicants. Please let us know of any accommodations needed so that you can bring your best self to the application process and beyond. All candidates considered for hire must successfully pass a criminal background check and credit check to qualify for hire. While we appreciate your interest in applying, an Equitable recruiter will only contact leading candidates whose skills and qualifications closely match the requirements of the position.

We can’t wait to get to know you!
Show more

The Analytics & Insights Sr. Analyst will be responsible for owning and driving the analytical models, experimentation, and reporting for the Customer Contact Center. The individual will support strategic initiatives by delivering actionable operational insights and analytical solutions. They will partner with both business stakeholders and technical teams to ensure data accuracy and availability, generate actionable insights, create self-serve dashboards, inform best practices, and provide clear recommendations for planning and optimizing our Customer Contact Center processes. This hands-on, technical role requires foundational understanding of forecasting techniques, statistical analysis, and NLP methods to address ambiguous and open-ended business challenges.

Own Analytical Requests & Reporting Needs for Customer Contact Center (60%)

  • Manage all analytical requests and reporting needs, including dashboards and written updates, for Customer Contact Center
  • Provide analytics and insights for key monthly and quarterly meetings with executives/senior stakeholders to inform strategic decisions and investments, FY target and performance tracking.
  • Maintain and upgrade existing PowerBI dashboards to deliver scorecards and actionable insights across business lines from the lens of call center and Customer Contact Center.
  • Support weekly and day-to-day tactical planning for call center stakeholders to ensure the freshest data and forecasting for workforce planning and management.



Own the Analytical Models & Experimentation Needs for Customer Contact Center (20%)

  • Perform complex forecasting and measure actuals against forecasts to identify key assumption changes and correlations to measured outcomes.
  • Assist in bi-monthly schedule forecasting and annual headcount forecasting.
  • Extract and manipulate data from multiple sources to proactively structure analysis, uncover data deficiencies, and share recommendations.
  • Utilize statistical and NLP techniques to generate actionable insights for business problems
  • Guide Product Managers with clear recommendations on experiment designing and interpretation relevant to the workstream, including phased rollouts of new technologies, such as chatbots.



Product Analytics & Supporting Strategic Decisions for Customer Contact Center (20%)

  • Conduct root cause analysis to proactively identify customer pain points from call and chat transcript data and provide recommendations to business leaders.
  • Collaborate with the Data enablement and BI Lead to ensure data completeness and availability for Customer Contact Center.



Let's Talk About You!

  • Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Engineering, Math, or Computer Science.
  • 3-6 years of work experience in Analytics, Strategy, Data Science roles, ideally in Financial services preferred.
  • Intermediate proficiency with Python and SQL, and prior experience with LLMs is required
  • Prior experience in Azure stack is preferred
  • Strong business acumen and passion for understanding and solving problems for consumers of financial services using rigorous data-driven methods and advanced analytical approaches
  • Experience in call center analytics projects will be a value add.
  • Excellent analytical, modeling and problem-solving skills.
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills.
  • Proficient in using MS Office (Excel, Access, Power Point).
  • Experience with databases (e.g. SQL code) and data visualization (e.g. Tableau) is an asset.
  • Strong attention to detail and time management skills.



What we offer [For full-time permanent roles]

💰 Competitive discretionary bonus

✨ Market leading RRSP match program

🩺 Medical, dental, vision, life, and disability benefits

📝 Employee Share Purchase Plan

👶🏽 Maternity/Parental top-up while you care for your little one

🏝 Generous vacation policy and personal days

🖥 Virtual events to connect with your fellow colleagues

🎓 Annual professional development allowance and a comprehensive Career Development program

💛 A fulfilling opportunity to join one of the top FinTechs and help create a new kind of banking experience

Equitable Bank is deeply committed to inclusion. Our organization is stronger and our employees thrive when we honour and celebrate everyone’s diverse experiences and perspectives. In tandem with that commitment, we support and encourage our staff to grow not just in their career path, but personally as well.

We commit to providing a barrier-free recruitment process and work environment for all applicants. Please let us know of any accommodations needed so that you can bring your best self to the application process and beyond. All candidates considered for hire must successfully pass a criminal background check and credit check to qualify for hire. While we appreciate your interest in applying, an Equitable recruiter will only contact leading candidates whose skills and qualifications closely match the requirements of the position.

We can’t wait to get to know you!

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Responsibilities

Position Summary:

As a Business Data Analyst, you will play a key role in analyzing and interpreting data from multiple sources, leverage data driven insights and advanced analytics to help guide strategic business decisions, optimize processes and improve operational efficiency. This role requires a strong technical skill. The ideal candidate possesses strong analytical mindset and a strong problem-solving skill and can translate complex datasets into actionable business recommendations.

Position Responsibilities May Include, But Not Limited To

Data Support


Monitor and troubleshoot data refresh processes for BI reports and dashboards.
Work with the team to identify and resolve data inconsistencies and errors.
Collaborate with IT and data engineers to maintain and optimize data pipelines.
Maintain documentation for data refresh schedules, configurations, and issue resolutions.
Assist in user support for report access and functionality issues.
Proactively suggest improvements to enhance data reliability and efficiency


Data Analysis & Interpretation


Extract, clean, and analyze large datasets from multiple data sources (JDE, KOMPASS, MBSYNC, Samsara, Paragon, among others) and data warehouse (Snowflake) to provide comprehensive insights into business performance.
Conduct deep-dive analyses to identify patterns, trends, and relationships in the data that will inform key business decisions.
Assist in the design and deployment of Prescriptive analysis to support process optimization and data insights.
Perform root cause analysis of business challenges and recommend data-driven solutions.
Identify opportunities for process improvements, cost reductions, and efficiency gains using data.
Ensure data quality and accuracy through proper validation techniques, best practices and governance processes


Reporting and Visualization


Design, develop, and maintain complex reports, dashboards, and visualizations using business intelligence tool like Power BI
Collaborate with department heads to define and track Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) relevant to the company’s strategic goals.
Translate business questions into data requirements and provide concise answers through reporting.


Machine learning and AI integration


Work with the data science team to identify opportunities to integrate machine learning and AI into business processes
Assist in the design, development, and deployment of machine learning/AI models to automate decision-making processes and optimize operations
Evaluate the results of machine learning models, ensuring they align with business objectives
Stay updated on the latest technology solution and integrate new techniques into business workflow


Stakeholder Collaboration


Work closely with various business units (Operations &Transportation, Finance, Supply Chain, ROP, REX, Centralized Routing) to understand their business needs and develop tailored technical solutions
Provide regular presentations of data insights, reports, and recommendations to senior management and executive leadership
Serve as the liaison between technical teams (Data ingestion, Data Engineers) and business stakeholders to ensure alignment in data strategies and technology implementations


Data Quality & Governance


Maintain data integrity, ensure data accuracy, and establish best practices for data collection, validation, and governance
Identify data gaps and work with data ingestion and IT teams to improve data architecture and system integrations
Ensure compliance with data privacy regulations and internal data governance policies


Project Management


Lead or participate in cross-functional projects focused on leveraging data to drive innovation and continuous improvement
Track project milestones, manage timelines, and ensure successful delivery of data-related projects within deadlines
Other projects or duties as assigned


Qualifications

Required Skills and Experience:


Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Data Science or a related field. Master’s degree preferred.
2+ years of experience in data analysis and visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau and Qlik
Willingness to learn and understand business operations across business units
Strong knowledge of data warehousing, ETL processes, SQL, DAX, M-Query, data source and data warehouse (Snowflake)
Familiarity with R scripting and Python.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail
Excellent communication skills with the ability to communicate and present complex ideas and data insights clearly and effectively to non-technical
stakeholders.Eagerness to learn new technologies especially in ML/AI space
Collaborative mindset with a focus on driving innovative solutions
Attention to detail and commitment to data accuracy
This position must pass a post-offer background check


Physical Demands And Work Environment

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Due to the nature of our business in regard to such things as delivery schedules, order inputs, selection, and Department of Transportation Hours of Service, overtime, attendance and punctuality are essential job functions. Should an individual in this classification not be able to adhere to this requirement due to a disability, they should contact their Human Resources department to see what, if any, reasonable accommodation may be made.

Title: Data Strategist
Description:
Job Description

Data Strategist

Rank 5

Scarborough, ON (Hybrid)

Deadline: Please apply before March 20, 2025.

Toyota Canada Inc. (TCI) currently has an exciting full-time opportunity for a Data Strategist reporting to the Manager, Business Analytics and Optimization. The successful candidate will leverage existing TCI data assets and assist all functional business departments. They will be accountable for compiling and creating presentations and business case materials for senior management, developing metrics and KPIs for existing and new programs to measure results and identify opportunities for improvements/kaizen, liaising with Toyota Financial Services (TFS), TCI departments and vendors to help customer communications in aid of lifecycle communications management program, and prepare stand-alone evaluations using data from different areas of the company to aid business cases, PDCA activities or other root-causes analyses.

What We’ll Bring:

Company & Culture


A hybrid work environment
A work environment built on teamwork, flexibility, and respect
Professional growth and development programs to help advance your career
A focus on respect for people and continuous improvement
Summer Hours – condensed work week during the summer


Benefits


Competitive compensation package including bonus
Extended health care and dental benefits effective immediately
Company pension plan with additional employer contributions
Associate vehicle discount program
Reimbursement programs (tuition & fitness)
Paid holiday shutdown and competitive paid time off benefits
Sabbatical leave program


What You’ll be Doing:


Design and maintain new and existing data visualizations and reports that allow frictionless access to key business measurements
Assist the Lifecycle Communication Management Vendor with customer data and guidance that will deliver relevancy to over 1 million Toyota and Lexus consumers in our database
Derive insights from data and convert into actionable recommendations  
Research customer demographics and psychographics to identify brand advocates and reveal trends
Mine TCI data to identify correlations that result in increased sales and service opportunities as well as cost avoidance
Collaborate with business departments and within SIP / PPD / Marketing / DSSO etc. in decoding issues in a solution-oriented environment
Perform ad-hoc evaluation and root-cause study to help Management PDCA
Set, monitor, and maintain key performance indicators (KPI’s) for internal departments and business communication tasks
As the senior member of the BAO team, collaborate with others to ensure that all tasks given to the team are accounted for and delivered in priority order to meet target dates
Mentor Junior members of the team to assist in growing their diagnostic and business techniques
Work with all TCI departments, TFS and Dealer representatives to develop PDCA analysis and project initiatives
Directly assist the organization in the achievement of corporate goals
Guide all business departments regarding needs for and access to multiple data assets
Advocate for data driven results across the organization
Initiate and implement appropriate ‘Kaizen’ efforts for efficiencies relating to cost reduction or avoidance, time, and process improvements
Work in conjunction with advertising agencies and partner companies
Other duties as requested or required


What You’ll Bring:


University and/or College degree in mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, or related area with work experience in a discipline such as: business analytics, business intelligence
Fluency with storytelling using data visualizations and other tools
Strong business acumen with the knowledge of how to translate non-technical requirements into technical queries and conclusions
Highly methodical and comprehends fundamentals of working with intricate data sets
Programming experience with data extraction and mining tools (SQL); Comprehension of primary keys and combining multiple datasets into new views
Excellent communication with a strong knowledge of how to translate intricate technical principals and ideas into business terms
Experience with Power BI and data warehouse ETL technologies
Experience in overseeing multiple projects and priorities
Self-motivator with knowledge of how to start and complete projects with limited guidance
Strong attention to detail
Automotive experience or industry knowledge is an asset


About Us

Toyota Canada Inc. is the exclusive Canadian distributor of Toyota and Lexus vehicles. Toyota Canada's head office is in Toronto, with regional offices in Vancouver, Calgary, Montreal, and Halifax. Toyota parts and accessories are distributed through TCI's Parts Distribution Centres in Bowmanville and Vancouver. TCI supports over 287 Toyota and Lexus dealers in Canada with services that include training, sales, marketing, environmental and customer satisfaction initiatives.

What Sets Us Apart?

A focus on people, passion for Toyota, innovation and continuous improvement have made us an award-winning company, recognized worldwide for our technological leadership and superior standards of quality, community involvement and environmental responsibility.

What You Should Know:

Our success begins and ends with our people. We embrace diverse perspectives and value unique human experiences. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer that celebrates the diversity of the communities where we live and do business. Applicants for our positions are considered without regard to race, ethnicity, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, religion, or any other characteristics protected by law. Please advise us at any point during the recruitment and selection process or your employment if you require accommodation.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At Bass Pro Shops and Cabela’s, we passionately serve people who enjoy the outdoor lifestyle by delivering innovation, quality, and value in our products and services. Live... Dream... Work the Adventure!




Summary:

Reporting to the E-commerce & Data Analytics Manager, the Data Analyst is responsible for the analysis of omnichannel sales, performance, and behavioral data. This position will require a technical skillset that includes daily use of SQL, DAX (Microsoft Power BI), and Python. This role requires an entrepreneurial outlook as we continue to find new ways to interpret and communicate actionable insights to key business stakeholders.




Location:

This position is a hybrid role that allows for 2 days of remote work and 3 days in the office. The office is located at 25 De Beats Street, Winnipeg, MB.




Responsibilities:

Build data visualization dashboards, tools, and infrastructure (Microsoft Power BI) that allow for the sharing of key metrics across multiple business groups.
Curate datasets from SQL databases to analyze and provide answers to a wide range of business inquiries.
Write codes to aid in data extraction and automation using APIs from internal and external sources.
Develop sales and KPI forecasts for omni-campaigns and eCommerce initiatives in collaboration with multiple departments.
Perform merchandise and product forecast analysis, transaction data analysis, seasonal merchandise demand analysis, and assist with customer lifetime value management reporting.
Support the digital marketing and eCommerce teams with actionable insights from data collected from tools that support social media, email, on-site personalization, and paid media.
Translate raw data and marketing results into easy-to-understand findings, including preparation of executive summaries and business reviews.
Aid in data validation to ensure accuracy of shared visualizations and datasets.
Other duties as assigned.




Qualifications:

Post-secondary education in computer science, statistics, or equivalent work experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role
2+ years of proven working experience as a data analyst or business data analyst
A minimum of 1-year experience working with SQL and Python
Demonstrated experience with BI Tools (MS Power BI preferred)
Experience gathering data from varying sources using APIs
Experience interpreting data and analyzing results using statistical techniques
Google Cloud Platform experience is an asset
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and creative solution-building mindset
Ability to translate data into actionable insights
Strong knowledge of and experience with databases
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Ability to prioritize work with good time-management skills
Proficient with Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, Outlook, Visual Basic)
Adapts to change in a fast-paced, deadline-oriented environment




Benefits:

Hybrid work from home options on Wednesdays & Fridays
Immediate employee discount
Fun work environment
Competitive wages
Excellent benefits
Unlimited career advancement opportunities







Bass Pro Shops & Cabela’s welcomes applications from people with disabilities.

Accommodations are available upon request during the assessment and selection process.

Title: Sr. Data Analyst
Description:
About Borrowell:

At Borrowell, we're on a mission to help Canadians feel confident about their money. We empower individuals to take control of their financial futures by providing the tools and insights needed to understand, build, and use their credit effectively.

1 in 10 Canadians use Borrowell for comprehensive credit monitoring and personalized insights. Our innovative services, including Credit Builder and rent reporting, help consumers build credit so they can unlock access to a wider range of financial products at more competitive rates. Additionally, we offer personalized financial product recommendations from Canada's most trusted providers based on each member's credit profile and financial goals.

Our team is diverse, inclusive, and driven by a shared passion for making a meaningful difference in the lives of Canadians. We pride ourselves on fostering a culture of collaboration, humility, and innovation. If you're looking to join a company that's transforming the financial landscape and empowering Canadians to achieve their financial aspirations, we invite you to explore career opportunities at Borrowell. Together, we can help Canadians feel confident about money.

About this role:

As a Data Analyst you will be a key member of Borrowell's Data Analytics Team. Your role will be pivotal in informing new marketing and product initiatives and powering the recommendations we personalize to each of our 3+ million members.

You will provide a window into business performance and help to make recommendations on what we build next. You will be responsible for creating and managing insights, experimentation, forecasting and reporting for various business partners at Borrowell. You'll monitor existing key performance indicators and explore new areas of data to drive business growth and product improvement.

You will make company data accessible, insightful and actionable to the different business divisions. Work collaboratively with our business development, customer engagement, and product management teams to drive continued improvement and help them fully utilize our data in their decisions.

Requirements


Experience


3+ yrs Working experience with business reporting, forecasting and providing insights to business decisions through data
Demonstrated proficiency of SQL (INNER and OUTER joins, WHERE, GROUP BY clauses, and aggregate functions, subqueries)
Experience building, analyzing and validating statistical experiments
Proficiency with analytic tools such as Looker, Tableau, or similar



Nice to Have


Undergraduate (or higher) degree in a quantitative field (Mathematics, Science, Eng, or Social Sciences)
Basic knowledge of Python (numpy, pandas, statsmodels, matplotlib, seaborn) or R (tidyverse: dplyr, data.table, ggplot2...etc.)



Important Qualities


Desire to continuously learn how to implement the latest technologies and analytical tools into our tech stack
A passion to improve the financial lives of Canadians through innovative use of technology and data-driven systems
Willingness to mentor others and embrace feedback
Open and transparent communication



Benefits


The Opportunity - join and have a major impact at a growing company that is helping make financial stability possible for everybody
Comprehensive Health Benefits - medical, dental, vision, and paramedical health benefits for you and your family, with extra yearly coverage for psychotherapists and massage therapists
Additional Health Benefits - virtual benefit offering that allows you to connect 24/7 with nurses, doctors and mental health professionals
Maternity & Parental Leave Top-up - available to new parents
Wellness Benefit - $600 annually to spend on whatever brings you joy
WFH Reimbursement - we ship you gear like a laptop, mouse, keyboard, and you can reimburse additional items to make your workplace better for you
Employee Development Benefit - annual reimbursements on payments to help your learning
Givewell Benefit - 1 paid volunteer day a year to give back to the community
Flexibility - flexible working hours and a flexible vacation policy



We are remote-first across Canada with an office in Toronto. This role will require you to attend in-person meetings and team-building events.

At Borrowell, one of our core values and firm beliefs is that diversity makes us better. If you're unsure about your qualifications for this position, we'd still encourage you to apply. We're looking for candidates who have experience, but know that not everyone's had a chance to demonstrate what they can do. What's most important is that you have a growth mindset and care about helping people with their finances - an area in their lives that causes a lot of stress.

Please note that due to the sensitive nature of the work we do, clearing a credit and criminal record check is a condition of employment.

Borrowell encourages applications from candidates with differing abilities. Please let us know if you require accommodation at any stage in the selection process.

HTML:
About Borrowell:

At Borrowell, we're on a mission to help Canadians feel confident about their money. We empower individuals to take control of their financial futures by providing the tools and insights needed to understand, build, and use their credit effectively.

1 in 10 Canadians use Borrowell for comprehensive credit monitoring and personalized insights. Our innovative services, including Credit Builder and rent reporting, help consumers build credit so they can unlock access to a wider range of financial products at more competitive rates. Additionally, we offer personalized financial product recommendations from Canada's most trusted providers based on each member's credit profile and financial goals.

Our team is diverse, inclusive, and driven by a shared passion for making a meaningful difference in the lives of Canadians. We pride ourselves on fostering a culture of collaboration, humility, and innovation. If you're looking to join a company that's transforming the financial landscape and empowering Canadians to achieve their financial aspirations, we invite you to explore career opportunities at Borrowell. Together, we can help Canadians feel confident about money.

About this role:

As a Data Analyst you will be a key member of Borrowell's Data Analytics Team. Your role will be pivotal in informing new marketing and product initiatives and powering the recommendations we personalize to each of our 3+ million members.

You will provide a window into business performance and help to make recommendations on what we build next. You will be responsible for creating and managing insights, experimentation, forecasting and reporting for various business partners at Borrowell. You'll monitor existing key performance indicators and explore new areas of data to drive business growth and product improvement.

You will make company data accessible, insightful and actionable to the different business divisions. Work collaboratively with our business development, customer engagement, and product management teams to drive continued improvement and help them fully utilize our data in their decisions.

Requirements


Experience

  • 3+ yrs Working experience with business reporting, forecasting and providing insights to business decisions through data
  • Demonstrated proficiency of SQL (INNER and OUTER joins, WHERE, GROUP BY clauses, and aggregate functions, subqueries)
  • Experience building, analyzing and validating statistical experiments
  • Proficiency with analytic tools such as Looker, Tableau, or similar


Nice to Have

  • Undergraduate (or higher) degree in a quantitative field (Mathematics, Science, Eng, or Social Sciences)
  • Basic knowledge of Python (numpy, pandas, statsmodels, matplotlib, seaborn) or R (tidyverse: dplyr, data.table, ggplot2...etc.)


Important Qualities

  • Desire to continuously learn how to implement the latest technologies and analytical tools into our tech stack
  • A passion to improve the financial lives of Canadians through innovative use of technology and data-driven systems
  • Willingness to mentor others and embrace feedback
  • Open and transparent communication


Benefits

  • The Opportunity - join and have a major impact at a growing company that is helping make financial stability possible for everybody
  • Comprehensive Health Benefits - medical, dental, vision, and paramedical health benefits for you and your family, with extra yearly coverage for psychotherapists and massage therapists
  • Additional Health Benefits - virtual benefit offering that allows you to connect 24/7 with nurses, doctors and mental health professionals
  • Maternity & Parental Leave Top-up - available to new parents
  • Wellness Benefit - $600 annually to spend on whatever brings you joy
  • WFH Reimbursement - we ship you gear like a laptop, mouse, keyboard, and you can reimburse additional items to make your workplace better for you
  • Employee Development Benefit - annual reimbursements on payments to help your learning
  • Givewell Benefit - 1 paid volunteer day a year to give back to the community
  • Flexibility - flexible working hours and a flexible vacation policy


We are remote-first across Canada with an office in Toronto. This role will require you to attend in-person meetings and team-building events.

At Borrowell, one of our core values and firm beliefs is that diversity makes us better. If you're unsure about your qualifications for this position, we'd still encourage you to apply. We're looking for candidates who have experience, but know that not everyone's had a chance to demonstrate what they can do. What's most important is that you have a growth mindset and care about helping people with their finances - an area in their lives that causes a lot of stress.

Please note that due to the sensitive nature of the work we do, clearing a credit and criminal record check is a condition of employment.

Borrowell encourages applications from candidates with differing abilities. Please let us know if you require accommodation at any stage in the selection process.

Title: Data Analyst - Product Analytics
Description:
WHAT MAKES US EPIC?

At the core of Epic’s success are talented, passionate people. Epic prides itself on creating a collaborative, welcoming, and creative environment. Whether it’s building award-winning games or crafting engine technology that enables others to make visually stunning interactive experiences, we’re always innovating.

Being Epic means being a part of a team that continually strives to do right by our community and users. We’re constantly innovating to raise the bar of engine and game development.

ANALYTICS

What We Do

Our Data & Analytics teams build powerful stories and visuals that inform the games we make, the technology we develop, and business decisions that drive Epic.

What You'll Do

Epic Games is looking for a Data Analyst to join the Product Analytics team focused on Fortnite. Your role will focus on the collection, interpretation, visualization, and analysis of our data to help drive and support our decision-making with a particular focus on cosmetics and monetization. The position's primary objective is to transform complex data into reporting that allows stakeholders to understand the data and draw actionable conclusions. In this role, you will take the initiative and work autonomously in a fast-paced environment. Your insights will shape how players access the content they love while building a sustainable business model for Fortnite.

In this role, you will


Partner with product, design, game development, art, and programming counterparts to identify opportunities to give players the most value possible out of our cosmetics and use data to develop metrics and insights that shape the execution of our cosmetic strategy.
Developing and maintaining standards for dashboards and reporting initiatives. This includes making sure data is visualized appropriately, creating consistent standards, and confirming that all data are accurate
Working with key stakeholders to identify needs and report outputs to answer questions and drive decisions clearly
Documenting requirements, developing, and delivering both written reports with analysis and charts on a dashboard
Working with programming and QA to consistently monitor and improve our data
Perform data analysis using data querying tools such as SQL and Spark



What We're Looking For


At least 3 years of professional experience as a Business Intelligence or Statistical Data Analyst
Demonstrated understanding of both contemporary video games and analytics best practices
Passion for games, analytics, and sharing data with others
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Experience working with development teams to instrument telemetry
Experience writing efficient and scalable SQL over billions of rows; it is a plus if you are familiar with distributed computing using Spark (Scala or PySpark)
Demonstrated skills in visualizing data (ideally using Tableau)
Comfort with supporting operational processes, including Code version control (Github or similar), Orchestration (Airflow)
Ability to prioritize, work with multiple departments, and deliver at a high speed
Prior experience in gaming ecosystems and/or monetization preferred



EPIC JOB + EPIC BENEFITS = EPIC LIFE

We pay 100% for benefits for both employees and dependents and offer coverage for supplemental medical, dental, vision, critical illness, telemedicine, Life and AD&D, long term disability insurance as well as weekly indemnity (short term disability) and a retirement savings plan with a competitive employer match. In addition to the EAP (employee assistance program), we also offer a robust mental well-being program through Modern Health, which provides free therapy and coaching for employees & dependents.

Pay Transparency Information

The expected annual base pay range(s) for this position are detailed below. Each base pay range is relevant only for individuals who are residents of or will be expected to work within the specified locale. Compensation varies based on a variety of factors, which include (but aren’t limited to) things such as skills and competencies, qualifications, knowledge, and experience. In addition to base pay, most employees are eligible to participate in Epic’s generous benefit plans and discretionary incentive programs (subject to the terms of those plans or programs).

British Columbia Base Pay Range

$118,592—$173,935 USD

About Us

Epic Games spans across 25 countries with 46 studios and 4,500+ employees globally. For over 25 years, we've been making award-winning games and engine technology that empowers others to make visually stunning games and 3D content that bring environments to life like never before. Epic's award-winning Unreal Engine technology not only provides game developers the ability to build high-fidelity, interactive experiences for PC, console, mobile, and VR, it is also a tool being embraced by content creators across a variety of industries such as media and entertainment, automotive, and architectural design. As we continue to build our Engine technology and develop remarkable games, we strive to build teams of world-class talent.

Like what you hear? Come be a part of something Epic!

Epic Games deeply values diverse teams and an inclusive work culture, and we are proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. Learn more about our Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Policy here.

Note to Recruitment Agencies: Epic does not accept any unsolicited resumes or approaches from any unauthorized third party (including recruitment or placement agencies) (i.e., a third party with whom we do not have a negotiated and validly executed agreement). We will not pay any fees to any unauthorized third party. Further details on these matters can be found here.

Title: Customer Data Analyst
Description:
About League

Founded in 2014, and with a total funding currently at $220 million; League is a platform technology company powering next-generation healthcare consumer experiences. Payers, providers, consumer health partners and employers build on League’s platform to deliver high-engagement, personalized healthcare experiences consumers love. Millions of people use solutions powered by League to access, navigate and pay for care.

The role

As a Customer Data Analyst, you will work with customers to help them better understand the unique digital engagement data that our platform generates that informs our ability to create engaging products and features that improve the health outcomes of our users. In this role, you will use in-depth analysis and governance of business intelligence, to depict the value of the League platform to enable and drive improvements to the customer experience and engagement that lead to improved patient health outcomes! You will surface key performance indicators with visual analytics platforms like Looker and Amplitude and work closely with other data analysts, engineers and scientists on the team to support the data models underlying the visual analysis dashboards/tools.

People who enjoy working within cross-functional and multi-disciplined teams both internally and externally will thrive in this role. Furthermore, you have experience in tying numbers to a larger, more strategic, business context. You enjoy communicating with non-technical stakeholders, using the art of converting simple questions into complex analysis and translating them back into meaningful and actionable insights.

Meet the Team

Our data team also manages an internal Business Intelligence product that primarily leverages a SQL-based ETL to surface key performance indicators company-wide within Looker. You will be working closely with data engineers and data scientists on the team to build and maintain our data pipelines to ingest and transform data from a variety of sources to support these BI tools.

In This Role, You Will


Support League’s customers in using our data to unlock insights on their end users using your expertise with data models and BI, managing data dictionaries, and deep dive and Q&A sessions.
Work closely with internal stakeholders to provide insights through analysis to help inform decisions in all parts of the business, including Product Management, Marketing, and Health Care.
Act as a SME for all things related to Reporting; guide users to the right set of KPIs and provide clarity on their meaning.
Develop analytics strategies and frameworks to monitor and analyze product performance and business KPIs related to application usage, and user engagement & conversion.
Work with data analysts, data engineers and data scientists on data requirements, reporting and forecasting of metrics and building out visualizations and data value stories.
Regularly conduct data quality audits and analysis to ensure the accuracy of data & reports sent to customers, in particular of the client events (ie clickstream data) generated by user button clicks and screen loads within the app.


Who You Are


You care deeply about using information and data in decision-making and have experience in communicating that logic to customers.
You are a strong communicator and enjoy collaborating with groups and training or educating teams to use data tools or to understand results.
You are a strong problem solver and can communicate the challenges and solutions effectively.
You are extremely customer-centric and create relationships with customers easily.
You like working in a fast-paced environment and are comfortable managing multiple tasks to tight deadlines.
You are eager to learn from others and help others grow with you.


What You Bring


Strong SQL skills, comfortable working with python
Experience working with data pipeline orchestration such as Airflow or Dataflow
Experience working with data engineering stack on cloud platforms like AWS, Azure or GCP.
At least two years of experience working as a data engineer, analytics engineer, data analyst or data scientist
Undergraduate or Masters degree in business administration, statistics, computer science or similarly quantitative discipline, or equivalent practical experience


Nice To Have Experience


Data analysis and data manipulation in Python (Pandas, PySpark, etc)
Healthcare industry experience
Worked with a SaaS company on customer facing data products
Backend Software Engineering experience and understanding


What We Offer


Comprehensive Health Benefits: We prioritize your well-being with complete medical, dental, and vision coverage
Bonus Program: Be rewarded for your contributions with our performance-based bonus program
Employee Stock Option Program: Become an owner and share in our success through our stock option program
Unlimited Paid Time Off: Take the time you need to recharge and maintain a healthy work-life balance
Spending Accounts: Manage your healthcare and dependent care expenses with tax-advantaged spending accounts
Wellness Days: Prioritize your mental and physical health with dedicated wellness days throughout the year
Growth Opportunities: We invest in your future with abundant opportunities for professional development and advancement
Mentorship Program: Benefit from guidance and support from experienced leaders in your field
Flexible Ways of Working: Enjoy the freedom to work in a way that suits your life and boosts your productivity


The Application Process

We believe applying for a job should be straightforward and transparent. Here’s what to expect:


Submit Your Application: You’ll receive a confirmation email right away.
Hiring Manager interview: Discuss your experience, skills, and motivations relevant to the specific job requirements
Talent Interview: Learn more about our culture, get alignment on your compensation expectation prior to committing to next steps
Meet the Data Team: Dive into technical discussions and learn how you can make an impact at League.
Final Steps: Meet our cross-functional team and the Executive leader and share experiences on collaboration and alignment with company values and strategic goals
Offer and onboarding!


We value your time and effort—our team is committed to providing updates throughout the process.

Security-related Responsibilities


Compliance with Information Security Policies
Compliance with League’s secure coding practice
Responsibility and accountability for executing League's policies and procedures
Notification of HR, Legal, Compliance & Security of any incidents, breaches or policy violations


CANADA APPLICANTS ONLY: The Canada-specific compensation range below for this full-time position is exclusive of bonus, equity and benefits. This range reflects the minimum and maximum target for base salaries for the position across all Canadian locations. Where in the band you may land is determined by job-related skills/experience. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range specific to your skills and experience during the hiring process.

Compensation range for Canada applicants only

$83,100—$100,000 CAD

Our employees come from different backgrounds, and we celebrate those differences. We are looking for the best candidates for our open roles, but do not expect applicants to meet every qualification in order to be considered. If you are excited about what you could accomplish at League and believe you can add value to our team, we would love to hear from you.

We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. If you are an individual in need of assistance at any time during our recruitment process, please contact us at recruitinginfo@league.com.

Our Application Process

Applying to a role you love can be exhausting, and understanding the next steps can feel vague and uncertain. You have done the hard part of submitting your application; let's do ours by sharing potential next steps


You should receive a confirmation email after submitting your application.
A recruiter (not a computer) reviews all applications at League.
If we see alignment with League's needs, a recruiter will reach out to learn more about your goals. The recruiter will also share the team-specific interview process depending on the roles you are exploring.
The final step is an offer, which we hope you will accept!
Prior to joining us, we conduct reference and background checks. Additional checks could be required for US Candidates, depending on the role you are exploring.


Here are some additional resources to learn more about League:


Learn about our platform, leadership team and partners
Highmark Health, Google Cloud, League: new digital front door to seamless care
Former Providence President and Workday EVP of Corporate Strategy join League Board of Directors
League raises $95 million USD in Series C to build world’s leading healthcare CX platform
Forbes x League: The Platformization Of Healthcare Is Here
Fast Company x League: If we want better innovations in healthtech, we need more competition


Recognize and Avoid Employment scams. Practice safe job searching.

Scammers are getting craftier and leveraging fake job postings to get personal information. Know the warning signs and protect yourself from scammers. Learn more here.

Privacy Policy

Review our Privacy Policy for information on how League is protecting personal data.
