Title: Senior Analyst, Business Intelligence (12-Month Contract)
Description:
Company Description

Make an impact at a global and dynamic investment organization

When you join CPP Investments, you are joining one of the world’s most admired and respected institutional investors. With more than $600 billion in assets under management, CPP Investments is a professional investment management organization that globally invests the funds of the Canada Pension Plan (CPP) to help ensure it is financially sustainable for generations of working and retired Canadians.

CPP Investments invests across regions and asset classes to build a globally diversified portfolio. It holds assets in public equity, private equity, real estate, infrastructure, and fixed income, and the CPP Fund is projected to reach $3 trillion in assets by 2050. The organization is headquartered in Toronto with offices in Hong Kong, London, Mumbai, New York City, San Francisco, São Paulo, and Sydney.

CPP Investments successfully attracts, selects, and retains talented individuals from top-tier institutions worldwide. Join our team for access to:


Stimulating work in a fast-paced and intellectually challenging environment
Accelerated exposure and responsibility
Global career development opportunities
Diverse and inspiring colleagues and approachable leaders
A hybrid-flexible work environment with an emphasis on in-person collaboration
A culture rooted in principles of integrity, partnership, and high performance
An organization with an important social purpose that positively impacts lives


If you have a passion for performance, value a collegial and collaborative culture, and approach work with the highest integrity, invest your career here.

Job Description

As a Senior Analyst, Business Intelligence, you will assist in gathering, managing, analyzing, and reporting of financial data to enable actionable insights and recommendations that support strategic decision-making processes. You will also be responsible for designing new dashboards to measure, analyze, and explain key aspects of the Fund’s activities.

Accountabilities


Utilize financial systems (e.g., Oracle planning module) to support period-end close processes, budgeting, and forecasting, and produce insightful dashboards and reports on cost drivers and trends.
Develop and automate reporting using technology to provide insights at scale
Iterative build and prototype dashboards, solving for analytical needs to drive data-centric decision-making, using tools like AWS QuickSight and Tableau.
Document processes and governance policies to ensure data integrity and system reliability.
Manage and maintain data from source systems, ensuring data accuracy and integrity.
Collaborate with various departments to understand their data needs and provide tailored analytical solutions.
Leverage technical tools (i.e. SQL, Python, Excel macros), complex data analysis on large volumes of unstructured data to validate data, investigate and resolve system and data issues.
Support Product Owners with analysis, prioritization, planning and delivery of new features and capabilities based on user needs.
Assist in developing test cases and automating control checks to ensure the accuracy and completeness of information being used.
Leverage analytical, problem-solving, and organizational skills to work with data providers and end users in assessing, transforming, and storing data for analytical and reporting requirements.
Participate in the development and implementation of new BI tools and technologies to enhance data analysis capabilities.
Manage your own workload to perform time-sensitive requests accurately and on time, while building effective working relationships within your team and across various groups at CPP Investments.
Stay updated on industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies in data analytics and reporting to enhance skills and capabilities.


Qualifications


Undergraduate degree or college diploma in related field.
3+ year of relevant experience.
Relevant professional designation (MBA, CPA or CFA) or progression toward one considered an asset.
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel; experience in data visualization tools (e.g., AWS QuickSight, Tableau, Power BI) and financial systems (e.g., Oracle)
Strong attention to detail and a commitment to data accuracy.
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and manage multiple priorities.
Demonstrated a thirst for learning new concepts and skills in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment


Additional Information

Visit our LinkedIn Career Page or Follow us on LinkedIn.

At CPP Investments, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability.

We thank all applicants for their interest but will only contact candidates selected to advance in the hiring process.

Our Commitment To Inclusion And Diversity

In addition to being dedicated to building a workforce that reflects diverse talent, we are committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible experience. If you require an accommodation for any part of the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms, etc.), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Disclaimer

CPP Investments does not accept resumes from employment placement agencies, head-hunters or recruitment suppliers that are not in a formal contractual arrangement with us. Our recruitment supplier arrangements are restricted to specific hiring needs and do not include this or other web-site job postings. Any resume or other information received from a supplier not approved by CPP Investments to provide resumes to this posting or web-site will be considered unsolicited and will not be considered. CPP Investments will not pay any referral, placement or other fee for the supply of such unsolicited resumes or information.

Title: Principal Data Analyst, Data Analytics
Description:
Job Requisition ID #

25WD85676

French job description to follow!/La description de poste en français se trouve plus bas!

Position Overview

We are seeking a highly skilled principal level Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. This role will be pivotal in driving our data and analytics strategy and contributing to our overall business objectives. The ideal candidates will have a passion for data, skilled at uncovering insights, and the technical expertise to implement solutions that propel our business forward.

You are passionate about delivering proactive insights and partnering with stakeholders to generate analysis that influence product roadmap decisions. You will play a pivotal role in empowering product teams by surfacing valuable customer and product usage data and acting a thought partner, guiding them in turning insights into strategic actions. Your expertise in uncovering trends and translating large streams of data into clear, actionable insights will drive forward platform strategic initiatives and elevate decision-making across our organization.

This role will be based in either Toronto or Montreal, Canada This role reports to the Senior Manager, Analytics.

If you are excited about empowering teams and influencing the organization with insights that drive success, this is the role for you!

Responsibilities


Collaborate with product managers and cross-functional teams to identify, define, and address business problems and opportunities through data analysis. Use your analytical skills to derive actionable insights from large and complex datasets
Monitor and track key performance indicators (KPIs) and objectives and key results (OKRs) across platform initiatives, providing regular updates and insights to key stakeholders and ensuring visibility into data-driven insights that support organizational goals
Work closely with product, engineering, and business teams to understand their data needs, provide analytical support, and communicate findings in a clear and concise manner to technical and non-technical audiences
Create clear and impactful data visualizations using tools such as Power BI, Looker, or similar, to communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders across the organization
Proactively mine for data drive insights to support initiatives, focusing on performance, user engagement, and overall business impact.
Develop and implement advanced data models and statistical analyses to forecast trends, predict outcomes, and optimize decision-making processes across platform initiatives
Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and integrity by following best practices in data collection, cleaning, and analysis, allowing for high-quality insights. Identify and resolve data discrepancies as needed


Minimum Qualifications


8+ years of experience in large data analysis, business intelligence, or a related field, preferably within a technology or SaaS environment
Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field such as Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related discipline
Strong skills in data querying and manipulation with SQL, and proficiency in programming languages like Python or R for data analysis and modeling
Experience with data warehouse ELT tools (Airflow, dbt, Snowflake)
Experience with data visualization tools such as Looker, Power BI, or similar, with the ability to create clear, engaging, and impactful dashboards. Familiarity with AWS, Azure or similar cloud platforms
Proven analytical and problem-solving abilities, with the capability to work independently on complex datasets and derive actionable insights
Knowledge of statistical techniques and modeling methodologies to drive in-depth data insights and support predictive analytics
Strong ability to communicate complex data insights and recommendations to technical and non-technical stakeholders in a clear and accessible manner
Effective team player with a strong ability to work across functions, engage with diverse stakeholders, and provide data-driven support for strategic initiatives


Preferred Qualifications


Prior experience working in a SaaS company or a platform engineering organization is preferred
Familiarity with Autodesk’s product portfolio and its applications in various industries is an advantage
Master’s degree in a quantitative field such as Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related discipline


Please note this posting is to advertise potential job opportunities. This exact role may not be open today but could open in the near future. When you apply, a representative may contact you directly if a relevant position opens.

Description Du Poste

Nous recherchons un analyste de données hautement qualifié de niveau principal pour rejoindre notre équipe dynamique. Vous jouerez un rôle essentiel dans la mise en œuvre de notre stratégie en matière de données et d'analyse et contribuerez à la réalisation de nos objectifs commerciaux globaux. Les candidats idéaux sont passionnés par les données, habiles à découvrir des perspectives commerciales et dotés de l'expertise technique nécessaire pour mettre en œuvre des solutions qui propulsent notre entreprise vers l'avant.

Vous êtes passionné par la fourniture d'informations proactives et le partenariat avec les parties prenantes pour générer des analyses qui influencent les décisions relatives à la feuille de route du produit. Vous jouerez un rôle essentiel dans l'autonomisation des équipes de produits en faisant émerger des données précieuses sur l'utilisation des clients et des produits et en agissant en tant que partenaire de réflexion, en les guidant dans la transformation des idées en actions stratégiques. Votre expertise dans la découverte des tendances et la traduction de grands flux de données en informations claires et exploitables fera avancer les initiatives stratégiques de la plateforme et améliorera la prise de décision au sein de notre organisation.

Ce poste sera basé à Toronto ou Montreal Canada. Il est placé sous la responsabilité du Senior Manager, Analytics.

Si vous êtes enthousiaste à l'idée de responsabiliser les équipes et d'influencer l'organisation avec des informations qui mènent au succès, ce poste est fait pour vous !

Responsabilités


Collaborer avec les gestionnaires de produits et les équipes interfonctionnelles afin d'identifier, de définir et de résoudre les problèmes et les occasions d'affaires au moyen de l'analyse des données. Utiliser vos compétences analytiques pour obtenir des informations exploitables à partir d'ensembles de données vastes et complexes
Contrôler et suivre les indicateurs de performance clés (KPI), les objectifs et les résultats clés (OKR) dans le cadre des initiatives de la plateforme, en fournissant des mises à jour et des informations régulières aux principales parties prenantes et en garantissant la visibilité des informations fondées sur les données qui soutiennent les objectifs de l'organisation
Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les équipes de produits, d'ingénierie et d'affaires pour comprendre leurs besoins en matière de données, fournir un soutien analytique et communiquer les résultats d'une manière claire et concise à des publics techniques et non techniques
Créer des visualisations de données claires et percutantes à l'aide d'outils tels que Power BI, Looker ou similaires, afin de communiquer les résultats et les recommandations aux parties prenantes de l'organisation
Exploiter de manière proactive les données pour générer des perspectives commerciales afin de soutenir les initiatives, en se concentrant sur la performance, l'engagement des utilisateurs et l'impact global sur l'entreprise
Développez et mettez en œuvre des modèles de données avancés et des analyses statistiques pour prévoir les tendances, prédire les résultats et optimiser les processus de prise de décision dans le cadre des initiatives de la plateforme
Garantir l'exactitude, la cohérence et l'intégrité des données en suivant les meilleures pratiques en matière de collecte, de nettoyage et d'analyse des données, ce qui permet d'obtenir des informations de grande qualité. Identifier et résoudre les divergences de données si nécessaire


Qualifications Minimales


Vous avez plus de 8 ans d'expérience dans l'analyse de grandes données, la veille stratégique ou un domaine connexe, de préférence dans un environnement technologique ou SaaS
Vous êtes titulaire d'une licence dans un domaine quantitatif tel que la science des données, les statistiques, les mathématiques ou une discipline connexe
Solides compétences en matière d'interrogation et de manipulation de données avec SQL, et maîtrise de langages de programmation tels que Python ou R pour l'analyse et la modélisation des données
Expérience des outils ELT pour entrepôts de données (Airflow, dbt, Snowflake)
Expérience des outils de visualisation de données tels que Looker, Power BI ou similaires, avec la capacité de créer des tableaux de bord clairs, attrayants et percutants. Familiarité avec AWS, Azure ou des plateformes cloud similaires
Aptitudes avérées à l'analyse et à la résolution de problèmes, avec la capacité de travailler de manière autonome sur des ensembles de données complexes et d'en tirer des enseignements exploitables
Connaissance des techniques statistiques et des méthodologies de modélisation pour obtenir des informations approfondies sur les données et soutenir l'analyse prédictive
Forte capacité à communiquer de manière claire et accessible des données complexes et des recommandations aux parties prenantes techniques et non techniques
Vous avez l'esprit d'équipe et une grande capacité à travailler dans plusieurs fonctions, à vous engager auprès de diverses parties prenantes et à fournir un soutien basé sur les données pour les initiatives stratégiques


Qualifications Souhaitées


Expérience préalable au sein d'une entreprise SaaS ou d'une organisation d'ingénierie de plateforme
Une bonne connaissance du portefeuille de produits Autodesk et de ses applications dans divers secteurs d'activité est un atout
Maîtrise dans un domaine quantitatif tel que la science des données, les statistiques, les mathématiques ou une discipline connexe


Veuillez noter que ce poste est destiné à annoncer des opportunités d'emploi potentielles. Il se peut que le poste en question ne soit pas ouvert aujourd'hui, mais il pourrait l'être dans un avenir proche. Lorsque vous posez votre candidature, un représentant peut vous contacter directement si un poste correspondant s'ouvre.

Learn More / Plus d'information

About Autodesk / À Propos D’Autodesk

Welcome to Autodesk! Amazing things are created every day with our software – from the greenest buildings and cleanest cars to the smartest factories and biggest hit movies. We help innovators turn their ideas into reality, transforming not only how things are made, but what can be made.

We take great pride in our culture here at Autodesk – our Culture Code is at the core of everything we do. Our values and ways of working help our people thrive and realize their potential, which leads to even better outcomes for our customers.

When you’re an Autodesker, you can be your whole, authentic self and do meaningful work that helps build a better future for all. Ready to shape the world and your future? Join us!

Bienvenue à Autodesk ! Des choses incroyables sont créées chaque jour avec nos logiciels - des bâtiments les plus écologiques et des voitures les plus propres aux usines les plus intelligentes et aux plus grands films à succès. Nous aidons les innovateurs à transformer leurs idées en réalité, transformant non seulement la façon dont les choses sont faites, mais ce qui peut être fait.

Nous sommes très fiers de notre culture ici chez Autodesk - notre code en matière de culture est au cœur de tout ce que nous faisons. Nos valeurs et nos méthodes de travail aident nos employés à prospérer et à réaliser leur potentiel, ce qui conduit à des résultats encore meilleurs pour nos clients.

Lorsque vous êtes un employé Autodesk, vous pouvez être entier et authentique et effectuer un travail significatif qui aide à construire un avenir meilleur pour tous. Prêt à façonner le monde et votre avenir? Joignez-vous à nous !

Salary transparency / Transparence salariale

Salary is one part of Autodesk’s competitive compensation package. Offers are based on the candidate’s experience and geographic location. In addition to base salaries, we also have a significant emphasis on discretionary annual cash bonuses, commissions for sales roles, stock or long-term incentive cash grants, and a comprehensive benefits package.

Le salaire est l'un des éléments de l'offre compétitive d'Autodesk. Les offres sont basées sur l'expérience et la situation géographique du candidat. Outre les salaires de base, nous accordons également une grande importance aux primes annuelles discrétionnaires en espèces, aux commissions pour les fonctions de vente, aux actions ou aux primes d'encouragement à long terme en espèces, ainsi qu'à un ensemble complet d'avantages sociaux.

Diversity & Belonging / Diversité et appurtenance

We take pride in cultivating a culture of belonging and an equitable workplace where everyone can thrive. Learn more here: https://www.autodesk.com/company/diversity-and-belonging

Nous sommes fiers de cultiver une culture d’appartenance et un milieu de travail équitable où tout le monde peut s’épanouir. Pour en savoir plus, cliquez ici : https://www.autodesk.com/company/diversity-and-belonging

Job Requisition ID #

25WD85676

French job description to follow!/La description de poste en français se trouve plus bas!

Position Overview

We are seeking a highly skilled principal level Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. This role will be pivotal in driving our data and analytics strategy and contributing to our overall business objectives. The ideal candidates will have a passion for data, skilled at uncovering insights, and the technical expertise to implement solutions that propel our business forward.

You are passionate about delivering proactive insights and partnering with stakeholders to generate analysis that influence product roadmap decisions. You will play a pivotal role in empowering product teams by surfacing valuable customer and product usage data and acting a thought partner, guiding them in turning insights into strategic actions. Your expertise in uncovering trends and translating large streams of data into clear, actionable insights will drive forward platform strategic initiatives and elevate decision-making across our organization.

This role will be based in either Toronto or Montreal, Canada This role reports to the Senior Manager, Analytics.

If you are excited about empowering teams and influencing the organization with insights that drive success, this is the role for you!

Responsibilities

  • Collaborate with product managers and cross-functional teams to identify, define, and address business problems and opportunities through data analysis. Use your analytical skills to derive actionable insights from large and complex datasets
  • Monitor and track key performance indicators (KPIs) and objectives and key results (OKRs) across platform initiatives, providing regular updates and insights to key stakeholders and ensuring visibility into data-driven insights that support organizational goals
  • Work closely with product, engineering, and business teams to understand their data needs, provide analytical support, and communicate findings in a clear and concise manner to technical and non-technical audiences
  • Create clear and impactful data visualizations using tools such as Power BI, Looker, or similar, to communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders across the organization
  • Proactively mine for data drive insights to support initiatives, focusing on performance, user engagement, and overall business impact.
  • Develop and implement advanced data models and statistical analyses to forecast trends, predict outcomes, and optimize decision-making processes across platform initiatives
  • Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and integrity by following best practices in data collection, cleaning, and analysis, allowing for high-quality insights. Identify and resolve data discrepancies as needed

Minimum Qualifications

  • 8+ years of experience in large data analysis, business intelligence, or a related field, preferably within a technology or SaaS environment
  • Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field such as Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related discipline
  • Strong skills in data querying and manipulation with SQL, and proficiency in programming languages like Python or R for data analysis and modeling
  • Experience with data warehouse ELT tools (Airflow, dbt, Snowflake)
  • Experience with data visualization tools such as Looker, Power BI, or similar, with the ability to create clear, engaging, and impactful dashboards. Familiarity with AWS, Azure or similar cloud platforms
  • Proven analytical and problem-solving abilities, with the capability to work independently on complex datasets and derive actionable insights
  • Knowledge of statistical techniques and modeling methodologies to drive in-depth data insights and support predictive analytics
  • Strong ability to communicate complex data insights and recommendations to technical and non-technical stakeholders in a clear and accessible manner
  • Effective team player with a strong ability to work across functions, engage with diverse stakeholders, and provide data-driven support for strategic initiatives

Preferred Qualifications

  • Prior experience working in a SaaS company or a platform engineering organization is preferred
  • Familiarity with Autodesk’s product portfolio and its applications in various industries is an advantage
  • Master’s degree in a quantitative field such as Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related discipline

Please note this posting is to advertise potential job opportunities. This exact role may not be open today but could open in the near future. When you apply, a representative may contact you directly if a relevant position opens.

Description Du Poste

Nous recherchons un analyste de données hautement qualifié de niveau principal pour rejoindre notre équipe dynamique. Vous jouerez un rôle essentiel dans la mise en œuvre de notre stratégie en matière de données et d'analyse et contribuerez à la réalisation de nos objectifs commerciaux globaux. Les candidats idéaux sont passionnés par les données, habiles à découvrir des perspectives commerciales et dotés de l'expertise technique nécessaire pour mettre en œuvre des solutions qui propulsent notre entreprise vers l'avant.

Vous êtes passionné par la fourniture d'informations proactives et le partenariat avec les parties prenantes pour générer des analyses qui influencent les décisions relatives à la feuille de route du produit. Vous jouerez un rôle essentiel dans l'autonomisation des équipes de produits en faisant émerger des données précieuses sur l'utilisation des clients et des produits et en agissant en tant que partenaire de réflexion, en les guidant dans la transformation des idées en actions stratégiques. Votre expertise dans la découverte des tendances et la traduction de grands flux de données en informations claires et exploitables fera avancer les initiatives stratégiques de la plateforme et améliorera la prise de décision au sein de notre organisation.

Ce poste sera basé à Toronto ou Montreal Canada. Il est placé sous la responsabilité du Senior Manager, Analytics.

Si vous êtes enthousiaste à l'idée de responsabiliser les équipes et d'influencer l'organisation avec des informations qui mènent au succès, ce poste est fait pour vous !

Responsabilités

  • Collaborer avec les gestionnaires de produits et les équipes interfonctionnelles afin d'identifier, de définir et de résoudre les problèmes et les occasions d'affaires au moyen de l'analyse des données. Utiliser vos compétences analytiques pour obtenir des informations exploitables à partir d'ensembles de données vastes et complexes
  • Contrôler et suivre les indicateurs de performance clés (KPI), les objectifs et les résultats clés (OKR) dans le cadre des initiatives de la plateforme, en fournissant des mises à jour et des informations régulières aux principales parties prenantes et en garantissant la visibilité des informations fondées sur les données qui soutiennent les objectifs de l'organisation
  • Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les équipes de produits, d'ingénierie et d'affaires pour comprendre leurs besoins en matière de données, fournir un soutien analytique et communiquer les résultats d'une manière claire et concise à des publics techniques et non techniques
  • Créer des visualisations de données claires et percutantes à l'aide d'outils tels que Power BI, Looker ou similaires, afin de communiquer les résultats et les recommandations aux parties prenantes de l'organisation
  • Exploiter de manière proactive les données pour générer des perspectives commerciales afin de soutenir les initiatives, en se concentrant sur la performance, l'engagement des utilisateurs et l'impact global sur l'entreprise
  • Développez et mettez en œuvre des modèles de données avancés et des analyses statistiques pour prévoir les tendances, prédire les résultats et optimiser les processus de prise de décision dans le cadre des initiatives de la plateforme
  • Garantir l'exactitude, la cohérence et l'intégrité des données en suivant les meilleures pratiques en matière de collecte, de nettoyage et d'analyse des données, ce qui permet d'obtenir des informations de grande qualité. Identifier et résoudre les divergences de données si nécessaire

Qualifications Minimales

  • Vous avez plus de 8 ans d'expérience dans l'analyse de grandes données, la veille stratégique ou un domaine connexe, de préférence dans un environnement technologique ou SaaS
  • Vous êtes titulaire d'une licence dans un domaine quantitatif tel que la science des données, les statistiques, les mathématiques ou une discipline connexe
  • Solides compétences en matière d'interrogation et de manipulation de données avec SQL, et maîtrise de langages de programmation tels que Python ou R pour l'analyse et la modélisation des données
  • Expérience des outils ELT pour entrepôts de données (Airflow, dbt, Snowflake)
  • Expérience des outils de visualisation de données tels que Looker, Power BI ou similaires, avec la capacité de créer des tableaux de bord clairs, attrayants et percutants. Familiarité avec AWS, Azure ou des plateformes cloud similaires
  • Aptitudes avérées à l'analyse et à la résolution de problèmes, avec la capacité de travailler de manière autonome sur des ensembles de données complexes et d'en tirer des enseignements exploitables
  • Connaissance des techniques statistiques et des méthodologies de modélisation pour obtenir des informations approfondies sur les données et soutenir l'analyse prédictive
  • Forte capacité à communiquer de manière claire et accessible des données complexes et des recommandations aux parties prenantes techniques et non techniques
  • Vous avez l'esprit d'équipe et une grande capacité à travailler dans plusieurs fonctions, à vous engager auprès de diverses parties prenantes et à fournir un soutien basé sur les données pour les initiatives stratégiques

Qualifications Souhaitées

  • Expérience préalable au sein d'une entreprise SaaS ou d'une organisation d'ingénierie de plateforme
  • Une bonne connaissance du portefeuille de produits Autodesk et de ses applications dans divers secteurs d'activité est un atout
  • Maîtrise dans un domaine quantitatif tel que la science des données, les statistiques, les mathématiques ou une discipline connexe

Veuillez noter que ce poste est destiné à annoncer des opportunités d'emploi potentielles. Il se peut que le poste en question ne soit pas ouvert aujourd'hui, mais il pourrait l'être dans un avenir proche. Title: Senior Analyst, Business Intelligence – 6-Month Contract
Description:
Company Description

Make an impact at a global and dynamic investment organization

When you join CPP Investments, you are joining one of the world’s most admired and respected institutional investors. With more than $600 billion in assets under management, CPP Investments is a professional investment management organization that globally invests the funds of the Canada Pension Plan (CPP) to help ensure it is financially sustainable for generations of working and retired Canadians.

CPP Investments invests across regions and asset classes to build a globally diversified portfolio. It holds assets in public equity, private equity, real estate, infrastructure, and fixed income, and the CPP Fund is projected to reach $3 trillion in assets by 2050. The organization is headquartered in Toronto with offices in Hong Kong, London, Mumbai, New York City, San Francisco, São Paulo, and Sydney.

CPP Investments successfully attracts, selects, and retains talented individuals from top-tier institutions worldwide. Join our team for access to:


Stimulating work in a fast-paced and intellectually challenging environment
Accelerated exposure and responsibility
Global career development opportunities
Diverse and inspiring colleagues and approachable leaders
A hybrid-flexible work environment with an emphasis on in-person collaboration
A culture rooted in principles of integrity, partnership, and high performance
An organization with an important social purpose that positively impacts lives


If you have a passion for performance, value a collegial and collaborative culture, and approach work with the highest integrity, invest your career here.

Job Description

The Business Intelligence team is responsible for delivering Total Fund reporting and analytics to consumers across the organization. The team works directly with Total Fund Management, Performance and Technology & Data collaboratively to establish processes, procedures, systems, and controls to ensure the accuracy and completeness of the quality of our enriched portfolio dataset.

Reporting into the Manager, Business Intelligence, the Senior Analyst will use their strong technical capabilities to support the daily Total Fund reporting process critical to investment decision-making, trade execution, servicing and reporting.

As a Senior Analyst, Business Intelligence, you will assist in gathering, managing, analyzing, and reporting of financial data to enable actionable insights and recommendations that support strategic decision-making processes. You will also be responsible for designing new dashboards to measure, analyze, and explain key aspects of the Fund’s activities.

Accountabilities


Support in the development of compelling materials to facilitate discussions and drive data-centric decision-making, including creatively conveying data and analysis with charts, tables and other visuals in pre-read and presentation materials using various visualization tools e.g. QuickSight and/or Tableau.
Support Product Owners with analysis, prioritization, planning and delivery of new features and capabilities based on user needs.
Partner effectively with multiple stakeholders to deliver effective presentations and create visual displays of quantitative information.
Develop and automate reports, iteratively build, and prototype dashboards to provide insights at scale, solving for analytical needs.
Leverage analytical, problem-solving, and organizational skills to work with data providers and end users in assessing, transforming, and storing data for analytical and reporting requirements.
Manage your own workload to perform time-sensitive requests accurately and on time, while building effective working relationships within your team and across various groups at CPP Investments.
Stay updated on industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies in data analytics and reporting to enhance skills and capabilities.
Assist in developing tests and automating control checks to ensure the accuracy and completeness of information being used.
Contribute to cross functional projects and initiatives by identifying issues, assessing implications, recommending solutions, and proactively managing tasks and timelines.


Qualifications


Undergraduate degree or college diploma in related field.
3+ year of relevant experience.
Relevant professional designation (MBA, CPA or CFA) or progression toward one considered an asset.
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel; experience in other relevant applications (e.g. QuickSight, Tableau, Power BI, etc.)
Demonstrated ability to produce insightful analysis of business issues and suggest potential solutions


Additional Information

Visit our LinkedIn Career Page or Follow us on LinkedIn.

At CPP Investments, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability.

We thank all applicants for their interest but will only contact candidates selected to advance in the hiring process.

Our Commitment To Inclusion And Diversity

In addition to being dedicated to building a workforce that reflects diverse talent, we are committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible experience. If you require an accommodation for any part of the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms, etc.), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Disclaimer

CPP Investments does not accept resumes from employment placement agencies, head-hunters or recruitment suppliers that are not in a formal contractual arrangement with us. Our recruitment supplier arrangements are restricted to specific hiring needs and do not include this or other web-site job postings. Any resume or other information received from a supplier not approved by CPP Investments to provide resumes to this posting or web-site will be considered unsolicited and will not be considered. CPP Investments will not pay any referral, placement or other fee for the supply of such unsolicited resumes or information.

Title: Data Support Engineer
Description:
The Data Support Engineer ensures the accuracy and integrity of sales, payment, and other critical data. This role involves data analysis, troubleshooting, and technical support, working with PostgreSQL, Python, and Linux to improve operations and create automation.







EXPECTED OUTCOMES AND DELIVERABLES




Data Analysis and Reconciliation:

Analyze sales, payment and related data to identify and resolve discrepancies, ensuring data accuracy.
Conduct detailed, line-by-line data analysis to pinpoint and rectify data errors.
Generate comprehensive reports on sales and payment data, providing valuable insights.




Technical Support and Troubleshooting:

Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues related to sales, payment, and data processing systems.
Utilize proficiency in PostgreSQL, Python scripting, and Linux environments to address technical challenges, improve operations and create automations.
Develop and maintain PostgreSQL and Python scripts for data manipulation, automation, and issue resolution.




Ticket Management and Support:

Manage and prioritize incoming support tickets related to sales, payment, and data processing.
Conduct initial assessments and triage of tickets, assigning them to appropriate personnel or resolving them directly.
Provide timely and professional communication to stakeholders regarding ticket status, progress, and resolution on a daily basis.
Monitor and manage ticket queues across teams, ensuring timely resolution and follow-up.




Operational Efficiency:

Develop and document efficient workflows for repetitive data operations tasks.
Perform manual data validation, identification, and reconciliation, taking corrective actions as needed.
Review ticket queues of all staff and assess what can be reprioritized, what requires updates and/or immediate attention, what required follow ups with the customer and team members, and complete the tasks or work on them till resolution.




Communication and Collaboration:

Communicate professionally and effectively with internal and external teams.
Provide regular updates and follow-ups on ticket progress and resolutions.




Tools and Technologies:

Utilize Excel and Google Sheets for data manipulation, analysis, and reporting.
Work within a Windows & Linux environment.
Create enhancements and automations using PostgreSQL and Python and other technologies available.




Provide accurate work estimations and ensure projects are completed according to schedule

Regularly communicate with all involved parties and teammates about progress towards milestones




Use assigned work tools to coordinate ongoing development initiatives and daily tasks

Monitor tickets on a daily basis to ensure assigned tickets are up to date and responded to appropriately
Ensure tickets maintain a high level of communication, and teammates are kept appropriately informed




Follow and promote best practices and performance standards

Assist in building and documenting workflows, procedures, and policies
Serve as a positive example to promote adherence to established performance standards







Skills & Qualifications




Technical Skills

Proficiency in Python, PostgreSQL, and Linux (Ubuntu).
Experience with Power BI and Jira is an asset.




Soft Skills

Detail-oriented with strong problem-solving abilities.
Excellent communication and teamwork skills.
Adaptable and proactive in troubleshooting and improving workflows.




Education & Experience

Post-secondary education in a related field is an asset.
Hands-on experience with the listed technical skills is required.




Work Environment & Expectations

Hours: Monday to Friday, 10 AM – 6 PM (some overtime may be required).
Location: Office-based, with occasional travel for work or company events.
Physical Requirements: Mostly computer-based work with potential for eye/wrist strain.




Career Growth

Opportunities to advance to Senior Data Support Engineer, Data Engineer, or Software Developer based on performance and company growth.







For serious applicants, we require Predictive Index to be taken,and will be asked to be completed before the interview process starts. Behavioral Assessment

Tools and Technologies:

Provide accurate work estimations and ensure projects are completed according to schedule

  • Ensure tickets maintain a high level of communication, and teammates are kept appropriately informed

Title: Senior Analyst, Business Intelligence
Description:
Senior Business Intelligence Analyst

The Senior Business Intelligence Analyst is a pivotal role that emphasizes advanced reporting and analytical initiatives. This position is responsible for developing robust PowerBI dashboards, leading data reporting efforts, and spearheading analysis projects to uncover actionable business insights. As a senior team member, you will also mentor junior staff and collaborate closely with internal stakeholders, including executives, to ensure that data and analysis drive strategic decision-making.

How You Will Make An Impact

Reporting & Dashboard Development:



Design, develop, and maintain dynamic PowerBI dashboards and comprehensive reporting solutions that drive strategic insights.
Collaborate with stakeholders to define key performance metrics, ensuring that reports provide actionable and timely data.



Analytical Initiative:



Lead in-depth analysis initiatives to uncover trends, identify business opportunities, and address complex analytical challenges.
Translate complex data findings into clear, strategic recommendations that inform business decisions.



Data Modeling & Metric Development:



Develop robust data models and establish metrics that accurately reflect business performance and support strategic objectives.
Work cross-functionally to ensure that data models align with business needs and reporting requirements.



Data Governance & Quality Assurance:



Oversee the implementation and maintenance of data governance policies and best practices to ensure data accuracy and integrity.
Conduct regular data accuracy audits and performance tuning of SQL databases to optimize data retrieval and overall system performance.



Mentorship, Collaboration & Project Management:



Mentor junior team members, sharing best practices and fostering a culture of continuous improvement.
Collaborate closely with internal stakeholders, including executives and cross-department teams, to gather requirements and manage BI reporting, data infrastructure, and analytical projects from inception through to successful execution.



Technical Expertise & Process Improvement:



Leverage expertise in SQL, ETL processes, data warehousing, and data marts to support and enhance the data infrastructure.
Continuously assess and improve existing processes and reporting frameworks to ensure optimal performance and scalability.



Success Criteria



Accurate & Timely Reporting – Delivers precise, actionable insights within deadlines, ensuring stakeholders can make informed decisions.
Effective Dashboard Development – Designs intuitive, real-time dashboards with relevant KPIs that enhance data visibility and usability.
Data Quality & Integrity – Ensures accuracy by implementing validation checks, resolving discrepancies, and using reliable data sources.
Stakeholder Collaboration – Engages with business units to understand needs, providing data-driven recommendations that drive measurable improvements.
Automation & Efficiency – Reduces manual effort by automating reports and optimizing data processes for improved efficiency.
Clear Communication & Visualization – Translates complex data into easy-to-understand insights using effective storytelling and visualizations.
Continuous Improvement – Regularly updates reports, dashboards, and processes based on user feedback and business needs.
Data Governance & Compliance – Ensures adherence to company policies and industry regulations, maintaining secure and well-documented data practices.



What You'll Bring



Bachelor’s degree in computer science, mathematics, statistics, economics, or similar field.
5 years of experience using Power BI or a similar BI platform (Tableau, Looker, Qlik, etc.).
5 years of experience developing and implementing business intelligence solutions, including modeling, design, development, optimization, and testing of reporting systems.
Strong critical thinking and problem-solving abilities with a solid understanding of relational data models, data analysis, DAX, ETL concepts, SQL, and performance optimization.
Ability to work on multiple initiatives simultaneously and work within tight deadlines.
Excellent communication skills to provide updates to all levels of management and stakeholders.



Preferred Experience or Skills (not required):



Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker, or Qlik.
Experience with data manipulation languages such as Python or R.
Experience with cloud platforms such as Azure, AWS, or Google Cloud Platform.
Experience with project management methodologies such as Agile or Scrum.



Equal Opportunities

At HearingLife Canada, we’re committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace. . HearingLife Canada is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. Should you require an accommodation throughout the interview process please do not hesitate to reach out to a member of our Talent Acquisition team today.

#Hearinglife_Canada

Title: Media Operations Data Analyst
Description:
imagi(nation)

We’re bold, creative, pushing boundaries, sparking innovation and creating the extraordinary on the daily. Still living the dream that brought a couple of university grads together in 1972. It’s that entrepreneurial spirit, that passion that drives us to find new paths for some of the most recognized brands in the world. We are an eclectic collective with multifaceted expertise, who act locally for global impact. We take risks. We empower. We go beyond.

To those who won’t settle for the expected—you’ve found your crew.

Being unique is something to be celebrated. We embrace differences. They allow us to challenge and learn from each other. The extraordinary comes from different experiences, different lives. It brings us closer. We speak 37 languages, have over 360 tattoos, compete in sports and give back to the community. All of this makes us one big team—and we like it that way.

As a Media Operations Data Analyst you will work as a hybrid financial analyst and data analyst and support our media teams. A significant portion of the role will involve building and maintaining forecasting and actualized investment and revenue dashboards. Some support on key partner negotiations and product development, as well as working with external partners on reporting cadence and needs.

Primary day-to-day responsibilities include:


Build and maintain media revenue forecast & actual for Cossette Media and Jungle Media across all offices.
Create google sheets for revenue tracking and add/remove clients as needed
Build/update Dashboard in Google Studio and links to key google sheets (or other data visualization solutions)
Update dashboard with revenue actuals on monthly basis as well as provide business leads with reports relating to previous revenues/investments
Build and maintain media spend projections & actuals
Create google sheets for media spend projections and add/remove clients as needed
Update dashboard with actuals
Update forecast with any partner agreement actuals on monthly basis
Work closely with partners to integrate their reporting formats cohesively with ours
Set up quarterly RFQ meetings with Business Leads (BLs) + other ad hoc meetings
Support/provide any Media Ocean report or Revenues forecasting information needed by the Business Leads (BLs) to assist with their forecasting
Conduct ad hoc media finance analyses to support the executive leadership team
Extremely detail-oriented and comfortable working with high volumes of data
Excellent organizational and time-management skills
Client facing experience an asset
Creativity when it comes to visualizing data to aid in more efficient and effective communication
Ability to work with multiple senior stakeholders


Qualifications:


Minimum 3 years of experience
Strong financial, analytical and project management skills
Proficiency with Google Suite; especially Google Sheets
Proficiency with Looker Studio (Google Data Studio)
Proficiency in SQL and Big Query
Experience with App Sheet an asset
Media planning/buying experience an asset however not required
Familiarity with client budget management and reconciliation invoicing process as well as Mediaocean (media operations system) an asset however not required


What’s in it for you:

We Value The ‘whole You’


An innovative and entrepreneurial work environment that promotes ingenuity and individuality - with the best of colleagues, and the best of clients
Hybrid work models and flexible hours, plus a work from anywhere policy for short-term stays in other regions
Generous Vacation starting at 3 weeks + 1 extra week over the holidays
Agency summer days (exact policy differs per campus and agency)
Modern, open co-working spaces with coffee & snack bars, located in great city neighborhoods, close to shops and restaurants and easy access to public transport
Dogs allowed, dedicated Play Room to support families and Private wellness room (in select offices)
Team social events - holiday parties, seasonal gatherings, weekly happy hours, inspiring speakers and more!


We are obsessed with learning and being better humans


In-house learning & development sessions and annual career and growth conversations’
Access to internal network of opportunities across all agencies
Focus on developing BIMPOC Talent via our BIMPOC Mentorship Program
Internal EDI group(s), programs & initiatives across Plus Company and opportunities to be involved in employee resource group(s)


Check out our EDI report here to learn more about our work and commitment towards equity.

We invest in your health and wellness:


Flexible benefits to support your individual lifestyle and life stage – with access to a personal wellness spending account you can use for a wide range of wellness expenses, including gym membership fees, pet care, education expenses, and much more!
Comprehensive mental health support including access to a virtual mental health therapy clinic providing you with personalized therapist guided iCBT programs and live therapy, access to health clinicians 24/7, and a holistic array of other health and wellness resources to support you and your family.
A responsible sick & personal absence days policy designed so you don't have to worry the moment a personal obligation or emergency arises.
Maternity leave top up program.


This Job Description Expires On April 8, 2025

We’re humbled by the number of talented people who apply to work with us every day. And, we thank each and every one of you. Truly. We’ll reach out directly to those we’d like to meet for an interview.

Creating meaningful work means embracing different perspectives. We are an equal opportunity employer and do not discriminate based on age, colour, ability, national origin, race, religion, sex, or sexual orientation. Not only are these provisions protected by provincial and federal law, embracing difference is what makes Cossette Media what it is—and we wouldn’t have it any other way. We pride ourselves on our inclusive and accessible workplace. If you need any accommodations during the interview process to make it work for you, let us know.

By joining Cossette Media, you become part of Plus Company, a unique partnership of forward-thinking creative agencies. As a network, we unabashedly believe anything is possible. Why? Because possibility is what powers the big dreams and limitless drive of an entrepreneur. And entrepreneurial agencies are what we’re made of. A whole network of them.

Check out our EDI report here to learn more about our work and commitment towards equity.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We evolve our games and how players interact with them by using the power of data to continuously uncover insights to deliver an even better player experience. We strive to be the best-in-class AI team in the gaming industry by maximizing the fun for EA players through easier deployment of AI-driven solutions for game makers. Our insights are ubiquitous through autonomous analytics.

The Data and Analytics (DnA) team is looking for a Data Analyst to work either hybrid or remote from Vancouver, BC. The Data Analyst will focus on improving data capabilities and business intelligence for our Quality verification teams, astute at spotting patterns, identifying risk and opportunity and convey complex concepts, using game data to improve our Game Development and Quality Verification strategies.

You will report to the Analytics Manager.


You will define the data analytics roadmap for some of EA's largest titles.
You will use your technical skills to develop data products that improve decision-making across the Quality Verification organization.
You will guide best practices in tools and visual technologies to help evolve the project dashboards to provide essential data for project monitoring.
You will develop scripts and queries to import and manipulate data from multiple sources.
You will help us promote a data-driven culture and support data governance practices to improve our organization's data maturity.


The Next Great Data Analyst Needs


2+ years of professional analytical experience, using data to improve processes.
Programming and Database experience with advanced SQL experience and efficient in Python.
Knowledge of different data software analytics and visualization tools such as Looker and PowerBI.
Able to develop data modelling and warehousing solutions.
Able to plan and prioritize multiple concurrent projects.
Able to foster working relationships with partners.


COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS The ranges listed below are what EA in good faith expects to pay applicants for this role in these locations at the time of this posting. If you reside in a different location, a recruiter will advise on the applicable range and benefits. Pay offered will be determined based on a number of relevant business and candidate factors (e.g. education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, geographic location, or business needs). BASE SALARY RANGES


British Columbia (depending on location e.g. Vancouver vs. Victoria)
$73,200 - $101,700 CAD

In British Columbia, we offer a package of benefits including vacation (3 weeks per year to start), 10 days per year of sick time, paid top-up to EI/QPIP benefits up to 100% of base salary when you welcome a new child (12 weeks for maternity, and 4 weeks for parental/adoption leave), extended health/dental/vision coverage, life insurance, disability insurance, retirement plan to regular full-time employees. Certain roles may also be eligible for bonus and equity.

You will guide best practices in tools and visual technologies to help evolve the project dashboards to provide essential data for project monitoring.
You will develop scripts and queries to import and manipulate data from multiple sources.
You will help us promote a data-driven culture and support data governance practices to improve our organization’s data maturity.


The Next Great Data Analyst Needs


2+ years of professional analytical experience, using data to improve processes.
Programming and Database experience with advanced SQL experience and efficient in Python.
Knowledge of different data software analytics and visualization tools such as Looker and PowerBI.
Able to develop data modelling and warehousing solutions.
Able to plan and prioritize multiple concurrent projects.
Able to foster working relationships with partners.


COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS The ranges listed below are what EA in good faith expects to pay applicants for this role in these locations at the time of this posting. If you reside in a different location, a recruiter will advise on the applicable range and benefits. Pay offered will be determined based on a number of relevant business and candidate factors (e.g. education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, geographic location, or business needs). BASE SALARY RANGES


British Columbia (depending on location e.g. Vancouver vs. Victoria)
$73,200 - $101,700 CAD

In British Columbia, we offer a package of benefits including vacation (3 weeks per year to start), 10 days per year of sick time, paid top-up to EI/QPIP benefits up to 100% of base salary when you welcome a new child (12 weeks for maternity, and 4 weeks for parental/adoption leave), extended health/dental/vision coverage, life insurance, disability insurance, retirement plan to regular full-time employees. Certain roles may also be eligible for bonus and equity.
Show more
HTML:
We evolve our games and how players interact with them by using the power of data to continuously uncover insights to deliver an even better player experience. We strive to be the best-in-class AI team in the gaming industry by maximizing the fun for EA players through easier deployment of AI-driven solutions for game makers. Our insights are ubiquitous through autonomous analytics.

The Data and Analytics (DnA) team is looking for a Data Analyst to work either hybrid or remote from Vancouver, BC. The Data Analyst will focus on improving data capabilities and business intelligence for our Quality verification teams, astute at spotting patterns, identifying risk and opportunity and convey complex concepts, using game data to improve our Game Development and Quality Verification strategies.

You will report to the Analytics Manager.

  • You will define the data analytics roadmap for some of EA's largest titles.
  • You will use your technical skills to develop data products that improve decision-making across the Quality Verification organization.
  • You will guide best practices in tools and visual technologies to help evolve the project dashboards to provide essential data for project monitoring.
  • You will develop scripts and queries to import and manipulate data from multiple sources.
  • You will help us promote a data-driven culture and support data governance practices to improve our organization’s data maturity.

The Next Great Data Analyst Needs

  • 2+ years of professional analytical experience, using data to improve processes.
  • Programming and Database experience with advanced SQL experience and efficient in Python.
  • Knowledge of different data software analytics and visualization tools such as Looker and PowerBI.
  • Able to develop data modelling and warehousing solutions.
  • Able to plan and prioritize multiple concurrent projects.
  • Able to foster working relationships with partners.

If you reside in a different location, a recruiter will advise on the applicable range and benefits. BASE SALARY RANGES

  • British Columbia (depending on location e.g. Vancouver vs. Victoria)
    • $73,200 - $101,700 CAD
In British Columbia, we offer a package of benefits including vacation (3 weeks per year to start), 10 days per year of sick time, paid top-up to EI/QPIP benefits up to 100% of base salary when you welcome a new child (12 weeks for maternity, and 4 weeks for parental/adoption leave), extended health/dental/vision coverage, life insurance, disability insurance, retirement plan to regular full-time employees. Certain roles may also be eligible for bonus and equity.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
LayerZero

The Future is Omnichain.

Founded in 2021, LayerZero’s vision is to create a community of cross-chain developers, building dApps that are no longer constrained by individual blockchain capabilities. With LayerZero's simple, generic messaging protocol, builders will develop cross-chain dApps designed to unify the power of individual blockchains.

We are funded by the best investors in the world including:

a16z, Sequoia, PayPal, Binance Ventures, Coinbase Ventures, Uniswap Labs, Circle Ventures, Delphi Digital, and many more.

About The Role

As we continue to grow at LayerZero, we're faced with an exciting set of challenges: more data, more developers, more teams, more projects, and more opportunities for innovation. To tackle these problems head-on, we're expanding our data team with a dedicated Data Analyst.

As a Data Analyst at LayerZero, you'll be at the forefront of shaping a rich data foundation for a company that's making a real impact in the web3 space. You'll work closely with teams and leaders to uncover insights, drive decision-making, and fuel our next-generation products and services.

What You’ll Do

As a key member of the data team at LayerZero, you'll be diving headfirst into the world of crypto data - exploring on-chain wallets and contracts, block and transaction data, insights from in-house systems, and third-party intelligence. Your mission will be to combine these diverse datasets into rich, actionable data products for a broad group of stakeholders.


Leveraging and expanding our ever-growing Kimball dimensional model.
Writing SQL to create and expand insights in our in-house reporting solutions.
Collaborating with stakeholders across the organization to conduct ad-hoc explorations and analytics - from engineering questions to help understand production issues to product insights that illuminate the broader crypto landscape.
Be a key owner of data quality, building out insights that serve the data team itself to help guide our data efforts towards cleaner and richer data.
Compose pipelines by writing SQL code to clean, combine, refine, and aggregate data into the insights the organization needs.
Collaborating on new datasets to ingest into our Snowflake data warehouse, working closely with data engineers on your team.
Not afraid of pushing code that supports tens of billions of dollars in daily transaction volume.


About You

We are looking for someone with previous data analyst experience. Likely with a bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Physics or related field, but we also consider and highly value equivalent practical experience.

Required


Strong SQL knowledge and experience
Proven track record in data modeling, statistics, and analytics
Experience working with a broad range of stakeholders
Strong convictions weakly held.
You enjoy working in a fast-paced start-up environment, where you'll need to take initiative and solve problems independently.
You understand the importance of data quality through incremental data development.


Bonus


Experience with general programming, we use Python and Go on the data stack
Experience with Snowflake
Experience building DAG based data pipelines
Experience with streaming real-time data pipelines
Previous experience with blockchain technologies, smart contracts, and decentralized finance
Experience with Kimball dimensional modeling
Working on a mid-to-large scale data stacks


Equal Opportunity Employer

LayerZero Labs is committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace. LayerZero Labs is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, religion, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, marital status, protected veteran status, disability, age, or any other legally protected status.
Show more

  • Working on a mid-to-large scale data stacks

Equal Opportunity Employer

LayerZero Labs is committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace. Title: Data Analyst - Product Analytics
Description:
WHAT MAKES US EPIC?

At the core of Epic’s success are talented, passionate people. Epic prides itself on creating a collaborative, welcoming, and creative environment. Whether it’s building award-winning games or crafting engine technology that enables others to make visually stunning interactive experiences, we’re always innovating.

Being Epic means being a part of a team that continually strives to do right by our community and users. We’re constantly innovating to raise the bar of engine and game development.

ANALYTICS

What We Do

Our Data & Analytics teams build powerful stories and visuals that inform the games we make, the technology we develop, and business decisions that drive Epic.

What You'll Do

Epic Games is looking for a Data Analyst to join the Product Analytics team focused on Fortnite. Your role will focus on the collection, interpretation, visualization, and analysis of our data to help drive and support our decision-making with a particular focus on cosmetics and monetization. The position's primary objective is to transform complex data into reporting that allows stakeholders to understand the data and draw actionable conclusions. In this role, you will take the initiative and work autonomously in a fast-paced environment. Your insights will shape how players access the content they love while building a sustainable business model for Fortnite.

In this role, you will


Partner with product, design, game development, art, and programming counterparts to identify opportunities to give players the most value possible out of our cosmetics and use data to develop metrics and insights that shape the execution of our cosmetic strategy.
Developing and maintaining standards for dashboards and reporting initiatives. This includes making sure data is visualized appropriately, creating consistent standards, and confirming that all data are accurate
Working with key stakeholders to identify needs and report outputs to answer questions and drive decisions clearly
Documenting requirements, developing, and delivering both written reports with analysis and charts on a dashboard
Working with programming and QA to consistently monitor and improve our data
Perform data analysis using data querying tools such as SQL and Spark



What We're Looking For


At least 3 years of professional experience as a Business Intelligence or Statistical Data Analyst
Demonstrated understanding of both contemporary video games and analytics best practices
Passion for games, analytics, and sharing data with others
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Experience working with development teams to instrument telemetry
Experience writing efficient and scalable SQL over billions of rows; it is a plus if you are familiar with distributed computing using Spark (Scala or PySpark)
Demonstrated skills in visualizing data (ideally using Tableau)
Comfort with supporting operational processes, including Code version control (Github or similar), Orchestration (Airflow)
Ability to prioritize, work with multiple departments, and deliver at a high speed
Prior experience in gaming ecosystems and/or monetization preferred



EPIC JOB + EPIC BENEFITS = EPIC LIFE

We pay 100% for benefits for both employees and dependents and offer coverage for supplemental medical, dental, vision, critical illness, telemedicine, Life and AD&D, long term disability insurance as well as weekly indemnity (short term disability) and a retirement savings plan with a competitive employer match. In addition to the EAP (employee assistance program), we also offer a robust mental well-being program through Modern Health, which provides free therapy and coaching for employees & dependents.

Pay Transparency Information

The expected annual base pay range(s) for this position are detailed below. Each base pay range is relevant only for individuals who are residents of or will be expected to work within the specified locale. Compensation varies based on a variety of factors, which include (but aren’t limited to) things such as skills and competencies, qualifications, knowledge, and experience. In addition to base pay, most employees are eligible to participate in Epic’s generous benefit plans and discretionary incentive programs (subject to the terms of those plans or programs).

British Columbia Base Pay Range

$118,592—$173,935 USD

About Us

Epic Games spans across 25 countries with 46 studios and 4,500+ employees globally. For over 25 years, we've been making award-winning games and engine technology that empowers others to make visually stunning games and 3D content that bring environments to life like never before. Epic's award-winning Unreal Engine technology not only provides game developers the ability to build high-fidelity, interactive experiences for PC, console, mobile, and VR, it is also a tool being embraced by content creators across a variety of industries such as media and entertainment, automotive, and architectural design. As we continue to build our Engine technology and develop remarkable games, we strive to build teams of world-class talent.

Like what you hear? Come be a part of something Epic!

Epic Games deeply values diverse teams and an inclusive work culture, and we are proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. Learn more about our Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Policy here.

Note to Recruitment Agencies: Epic does not accept any unsolicited resumes or approaches from any unauthorized third party (including recruitment or placement agencies) (i.e., a third party with whom we do not have a negotiated and validly executed agreement). We will not pay any fees to any unauthorized third party. Further details on these matters can be found here.
Show more
